ï»¿THE LIGHT THAT FAILED

By [Rudyard Kipling]144-rudyard kipling CHAPTER [I]0-i

So [we]305-we settled it all when the storm was done As comf'y as comf'y could be ; And [I]0-i was to wait in [the barn]306-the barn , [[my]0-i dears]307-my dears , Because [I]0-i was only three ; And [Teddy]145-teddy would run to the rainbow 's foot , Because [he]145-teddy was five and [a man]308-a man ; And that 's how it all began , [[my]0-i dears]307-my dears , And that 's how it all began .

- [Big Barn Stories]1-big barn stories . ' WHAT do [you]2160-you think [she]146-maisie 'd do if [she]146-maisie caught [us]305-we ? [We]305-we ought n't to have it , [you]2160-you know , '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie .

' Beat [me]147-dick , and lock [you]146-maisie up in [[your]146-maisie bedroom]2161-your bedroom , '[147-dick] [Dick]147-dick answered , without hesitation . ' Have [you]146-maisie got the cartridges ? '[147-dick]

' Yes ; they 're[147-dick] in [my]0-i pocket , but they are joggling horribly . Do pin - fire cartridges go off of [their]310-their own accord ? '[310-their]

' Do n't know . Take the revolver , if [you]146-maisie are afraid , and let [me]147-dick carry them . '[147-dick]

' [I]310-their 'm[310-their] not afraid . ' [Maisie]146-maisie strode forward swiftly , a hand in [her]146-maisie pocket and [her]146-maisie chin in the air . [Dick]147-dick followed with a small pin - fire revolver .[310-their]

[The children]311-the children had discovered that [their]311-the children lives would be unendurable without pistol - practice . After much forethought and self - denial , [Dick]147-dick had saved seven shillings and sixpence , the price of a badly constructed Belgian revolver . [Maisie]146-maisie could only contribute half a crown to [the syndicate]312-the syndicate for the purchase of a hundred cartridges . ' [You]147-dick can save better than [I]146-maisie can , [Dick]147-dick , '[146-maisie] [she]146-maisie explained ; ' [I]146-maisie like nice things to eat , and it does n't matter to [you]147-dick . Besides , [boys]2162-boys ought to do these things . '[146-maisie]

[Dick]147-dick grumbled a little at the arrangement , but went out and made the purchase , which [the children]311-the children were then on [their]311-the children way to test . Revolvers did not lie in the scheme of [their]311-the children daily life as decreed for [them]311-the children by [the guardian who was incorrectly supposed to stand in the place of [a mother to [these two orphans]316-these two orphans]315-a mother to these two orphans]314-the guardian who was incorrectly supposed to stand in the place of a mother to these two orphans . [Dick]147-dick had been under [her]146-maisie care for six years , during which time [she]146-maisie had made [her]146-maisie profit of the allowances supposed to be expended on [his]147-dick clothes , and , partly through thoughtlessness , partly through a natural desire to pain , - [she]146-maisie was [a widow of some years anxious to marry again]317-a widow of some years anxious to marry again , - had made [his]147-dick days burdensome on [his]147-dick young shoulders .

Where [he]147-dick had looked for love , [she]146-maisie gave [him]147-dick first aversion and then hate .

Where [he]147-dick growing older had sought a little sympathy , [she]146-maisie gave [him]147-dick ridicule . The many hours that [she]146-maisie could spare from the ordering of [[her]146-maisie small house]318-her small house [she]146-maisie devoted to what [she]146-maisie called [the home - training of [Dick Heldar]147-dick]319-the home - training of dick heldar . [Her]146-maisie religion , manufactured in the main by [her]146-maisie own intelligence and a keen study of the Scriptures , was an aid to [her]146-maisie in this matter . At such times as [she]146-maisie [herself]146-maisie was not personally displeased with [Dick]147-dick , [she]146-maisie left [him]147-dick to understand that [he]147-dick had a heavy account to settle with [[his]147-dick Creator]320-his creator ; wherefore [Dick]147-dick learned to loathe [[his]147-dick God]321-his god as intensely as [he]147-dick loathed [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett ; and this is not a wholesome frame of mind for [the young]322-the young . Since [she]146-maisie chose to regard [him]147-dick as [a hopeless liar]323-a hopeless liar , but [an economical and self - contained one]324-an economical and self - contained one , never throwing away the least unnecessary fib , and never hesitating at the blackest , were it only plausible , that might make [his]147-dick life a little easier . The treatment taught [him]147-dick at least the power of living alone , - a power that was of service to [him]147-dick when [he]147-dick went to [a public school]325-a public school and [the boys]326-the boys laughed at [his]147-dick clothes , which were poor in quality and much mended . In the holidays [he]147-dick returned to the teachings of [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett , and , that the chain of discipline might not be weakened by association with [the world]327-the world , was generally beaten , on one account or another , before [he]147-dick had been twelve hours under [her]148-mrs. jennett roof .

The autumn of one year brought [him]147-dick [a companion in bondage]328-a companion in bondage , [a long - haired , gray - eyed little atom , as self - contained as [himself]147-dick , who moved about [the house]330-the house silently and for the first few weeks spoke only to the goat that was [[her]148-mrs. jennett chiefest friend on [earth]332-earth]331-her chiefest friend on earth and lived in [the back - garden]333-the back - garden]329-a long - haired , gray - eyed little atom , as self - contained as himself , who moved about the house silently and for the first few weeks spoke only to the goat that was her chiefest friend on earth and lived in the back - garden . [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett objected to the goat on the grounds that [he]147-dick was un - Christian , - which [he]147-dick certainly was . ' Then , '[334-the atom] said [the atom]334-the atom , choosing [her]334-the atom words very deliberately , ' [I]334-the atom shall write to [[my]334-the atom lawyer - peoples]2163-my lawyer - peoples and tell [them]2163-my lawyer - peoples that [you]147-dick are [a very bad woman]2164-a very bad woman . [Amomma]149-amomma is [mine]2165-mine , [mine]2165-mine , [mine]2165-mine ! '[334-the atom] [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett made a movement to [the hall]335-the hall , where certain umbrellas and canes stood in a rack . [The atom]150-the atom understood as clearly as [Dick]147-dick what this meant . ' [I]334-the atom have been beaten before , '[334-the atom] [she]334-the atom said , still in the same passionless voice ; ' [I]334-the atom have been beaten worse than [you]147-dick can ever beat [me]334-the atom . If [you]147-dick beat [me]334-the atom [I]334-the atom shall write to [[my]334-the atom lawyer - peoples]2163-my lawyer - peoples and tell [them]2163-my lawyer - peoples that [you]147-dick do not give [me]334-the atom enough to eat . [I]334-the atom am not afraid of [you]147-dick . '[334-the atom] [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett did not go into [the hall]335-the hall , and [the atom]334-the atom , after a pause to assure [herself]334-the atom that all danger of war was past , went out , to weep bitterly on [Amomma]149-amomma 's neck .

[Dick]147-dick learned to know [her]334-the atom as [Maisie]146-maisie , and at first mistrusted [her]334-the atom profoundly , for [he]147-dick feared that [she]334-the atom might interfere with the small liberty of action left to [him]147-dick . [She]334-the atom did not , however ; and [she]334-the atom volunteered no friendliness until [Dick]147-dick had taken the first steps . Long before the holidays were over , the stress of punishment shared in common drove [the children]311-the children together , if it were only to play into [each other]339-each other 's hands as [they]311-the children prepared lies for [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett 's use . When [Dick]147-dick returned to [school]340-school , [Maisie]146-maisie whispered , ' Now [I]146-maisie shall be all alone to take care of [myself]146-maisie ; but , '[146-maisie] and [she]146-maisie nodded [her]146-maisie head bravely , ' [I]146-maisie can do it . [You]147-dick promised to send [Amomma]149-amomma a grass collar . Send it soon . '[146-maisie] A week later [she]146-maisie asked for that collar by return of post , and was not pleased when [she]146-maisie learned that it took time to make . When at last [Dick]147-dick forwarded the gift , [she]146-maisie forgot to thank [him]147-dick for it .

Many holidays had come and gone since that day , and [Dick]147-dick had grown into [a lanky hobbledehoy]341-a lanky hobbledehoy more than ever conscious of [his]147-dick bad clothes . Not for a moment had [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett relaxed [her]148-mrs. jennett tender care of [him]147-dick , but [the average canings of [a public school]325-a public school]342-the average canings of a public school - [Dick]147-dick fell under punishment about three times a month - filled [him]147-dick with contempt for [her]146-maisie powers . ' [She]146-maisie does n't hurt , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick explained to [Maisie]146-maisie , who urged [him]147-dick to rebellion , ' and [she]146-maisie is kinder to [you]146-maisie after [she]146-maisie has whacked [me]147-dick . '[147-dick] [Dick]147-dick shambled through the days unkempt in body and savage in soul , as [the smaller boys of the school]344-the smaller boys of the school learned to know , for when the spirit moved [him]147-dick [he]147-dick would hit [them]344-the smaller boys of the school , cunningly and with science . The same spirit made [him]147-dick more than once try to tease [Maisie]146-maisie , but [the girl]345-the girl refused to be made unhappy . ' [We]2167-we are both miserable as it is , '[345-the girl] said [she]345-the girl . ' What is the use of trying to make things worse ? Let 's find things to do , and forget things . '[345-the girl]

The pistol was the outcome of that search . It could only be used on [the muddiest foreshore of [the beach]347-the beach]346-the muddiest foreshore of the beach , far away from [the bathing - machines and pierheads]348-the bathing - machines and pierheads , below [the grassy slopes of [Fort Keeling]2-fort keeling]349-the grassy slopes of fort keeling . The tide ran out nearly two miles on [that coast]350-that coast , and [the many - coloured mud - banks]351-the many - coloured mud - banks , touched by the sun , sent up a lamentable smell of dead weed . It was late in the afternoon when [Dick]147-dick and [Maisie]146-maisie arrived on [their]352-their ground , [Amomma]149-amomma trotting patiently behind [them]352-their .

' Mf ! '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , sniffing the air . ' [I]146-maisie wonder what makes [the sea]2168-the sea so smelly ? [I]146-maisie do n't like it ! '[146-maisie]

' [You]146-maisie never like anything that is n't made just for [you]146-maisie , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick bluntly . ' Give [me]147-dick the cartridges , and [I]147-dick 'll try first shot . How far does one of these little revolvers carry ? '[147-dick]

' Oh , half a mile , '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , promptly . ' At least it makes an awful noise . Be careful with the cartridges ; [I]146-maisie do n't like those jagged stick - up things on the rim . [Dick]147-dick , do be careful . '[146-maisie]

' All right . [I]147-dick know how to load . [I]147-dick 'll fire at the breakwater out there . '[147-dick]

[He]147-dick fired , and [Amomma]149-amomma ran away bleating . The bullet threw up a spurt of mud to the right of the wood - wreathed piles .

' Throws high and to the right . [You]146-maisie try , [Maisie]146-maisie . Mind , it 's loaded all round . '[146-maisie]

[Maisie]146-maisie took the pistol and stepped delicately to the verge of the mud , [her]146-maisie hand firmly closed on the butt , [her]146-maisie mouth and left eye screwed up .

[Dick]147-dick sat down on a tuft of bank and laughed . [Amomma]149-amomma returned very cautiously . [He]149-amomma was accustomed to strange experiences in [his]149-amomma afternoon walks , and , finding the cartridge - box unguarded , made investigations with [his]149-amomma nose . [Maisie]146-maisie fired , but could not see where the bullet went .

' [I]146-maisie think it hit the post , '[146-maisie] [she]146-maisie said , shading [her]146-maisie eyes and looking out across [the sailless sea]353-the sailless sea .

' [I]147-dick know it has gone out to [the Marazion Bell - buoy]2169-the marazion bell - buoy , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , with a chuckle . ' Fire low and to the left ; then perhaps [you]146-maisie 'll get it . Oh , look at [Amomma]149-amomma ! - [he]149-amomma 's eating the cartridges ! '[147-dick]

[Maisie]146-maisie turned , the revolver in [her]146-maisie hand , just in time to see [Amomma]149-amomma scampering away from the pebbles [Dick]147-dick threw after [him]149-amomma . Nothing is sacred to [a billy - goat]354-a billy - goat . Being well fed and the adored of [[his]149-amomma mistress]355-his mistress , [Amomma]149-amomma had naturally swallowed two loaded pin - fire cartridges . [Maisie]146-maisie hurried up to assure [herself]146-maisie that [Dick]147-dick had not miscounted the tale .

' Yes , [he]149-amomma 's eaten two . '[147-dick]

' [Horrid little beast]2170-horrid little beast ! Then [they]2171-they 'll joggle about inside [him]149-amomma and blow up , and serve [him]149-amomma right .... Oh , [Dick]147-dick ! have [I]146-maisie killed [you]147-dick ? '[146-maisie]

Revolvers are tricky things for [young hands to deal with]356-young hands to deal with . [Maisie]146-maisie could not explain how it had happened , but a veil of reeking smoke separated [her]146-maisie from [Dick]147-dick , and [she]146-maisie was quite certain that the pistol had gone off in [his]147-dick face . Then [she]146-maisie heard [him]147-dick sputter , and dropped on [her]146-maisie knees beside [him]147-dick , crying , ' [Dick]147-dick , [you]147-dick are n't hurt , are [you]147-dick ? [I]146-maisie did n't mean it . '[146-maisie]

' Of course [you]147-dick did n't , said [Dick]147-dick , coming out of the smoke and wiping [his]147-dick cheek . '[146-maisie] But [you]147-dick nearly blinded [me]0-i . That powder stuff stings awfully . ' A neat little splash of gray led on a stone showed where the bullet had gone . [Maisie]146-maisie began to whimper .[147-dick]

' Do n't , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , jumping to [his]147-dick feet and shaking [himself]147-dick . ' [I]147-dick 'm[147-dick] not a bit hurt . '[147-dick]

' No , but [I]146-maisie might have killed [you]147-dick , '[146-maisie] protested [Maisie]146-maisie , the corners of [her]146-maisie mouth drooping . ' What should [I]146-maisie have done then ? '[146-maisie]

' Gone [home]2172-home and told [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett . '[147-dick] [Dick]147-dick grinned at the thought ; then , softening , ' Please do n't worry about it . Besides , [we]357-we are wasting time .[147-dick]

[We]357-we 've got to get back to tea . [I]0-i 'll take the revolver for a bit . '[0-i]

[Maisie]146-maisie would have wept on the least encouragement , but [Dick]147-dick 's indifference , albeit [his]147-dick hand was shaking as [he]147-dick picked up the pistol , restrained [her]146-maisie . [She]146-maisie lay panting on [the beach]347-the beach while [Dick]147-dick methodically bombarded [the breakwater]359-the breakwater . ' Got it at last ! '[147-dick] [he]147-dick exclaimed , as a lock of weed flew from the wood .

' Let [me]146-maisie try , '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , imperiously . ' [I]146-maisie 'm[146-maisie] all right now . '[146-maisie]

[They]357-we fired in turns till the rickety little revolver nearly shook itself to pieces , and [Amomma]149-amomma [the outcast]360-the outcast - because [he]149-amomma might blow up at any moment - browsed in the background and wondered why stones were thrown at [him]149-amomma . Then [they]357-we found a balk of timber floating in a pool which was commanded by [the seaward slope of [Fort Keeling]2-fort keeling]361-the seaward slope of fort keeling , and [they]357-we sat down together before this new target .

' [Next holidays]2173-next holidays , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , as the now thoroughly fouled revolver kicked wildly in [his]147-dick hand , ' [we]357-we 'll get another pistol , - central fire , - that will carry farther . '[147-dick]

' There wo n't be any next holidays for [me]146-maisie , '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie . ' [I]146-maisie 'm[146-maisie] going away . '[146-maisie]

' Where to ? '[147-dick]

' [I]146-maisie do n't know . [[My]146-maisie lawyers]2174-my lawyers have written to [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett , and [I]146-maisie 've got to be educated somewhere , - in [France]3-france , perhaps , - [I]146-maisie do n't know where ; but [I]146-maisie shall be glad to go away . '[146-maisie]

' [I]147-dick sha n't like it a bit . [I]147-dick suppose [I]147-dick shall be left . Look here , [Maisie]146-maisie , is it really true [you]146-maisie 're[147-dick] going ? Then these holidays will be the last [I]0-i shall see anything of [you]146-maisie ; and [I]0-i go back to [school]340-school next week . [I]0-i wish - - '[0-i]

[The young blood]363-the young blood turned [his]0-i cheeks scarlet . [Maisie]146-maisie was picking grass - tufts and throwing them down [the slope]364-the slope at [a yellow sea - poppy]365-a yellow sea - poppy nodding all by itself to the illimitable levels of [the mud - flats]366-the mud - flats and [the milk - white sea beyond]367-the milk - white sea beyond .

' [I]146-maisie wish , '[146-maisie] [she]146-maisie said , after a pause , ' that [I]146-maisie could see [you]0-i again sometime .[146-maisie]

[You]0-i wish that , too ? '[146-maisie]

' Yes , but it would have been better if - if - [you]0-i had - shot straight over there - down by [the breakwater]359-the breakwater . '[146-maisie]

[Maisie]146-maisie looked with large eyes for a moment . And this was the boy who only ten days before had decorated [Amomma]149-amomma 's horns with cut - paper ham - frills and turned [him]0-i out , a bearded derision , among the public ways ! Then [she]146-maisie dropped [her]146-maisie eyes : this was not [the boy]368-the boy .

' Do n't be stupid , '[146-maisie] [she]146-maisie said reprovingly , and with swift instinct attacked the side - issue . ' How selfish [you]0-i are ! Just think what [I]146-maisie should have felt if that horrid thing had killed [you]0-i ! [I]146-maisie 'm[146-maisie] quite miserable enough already . '[146-maisie]

' Why ? Because [you]0-i 're[146-maisie] going away from [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett ? '[148-mrs. jennett]

' No . '[146-maisie]

' From [me]148-mrs. jennett , then ? '[148-mrs. jennett]

No answer for a long time . [Dick]147-dick dared not look at [her]146-maisie . [He]147-dick felt , though [he]147-dick did not know , all that the past four years had been to [him]147-dick , and this the more acutely since [he]147-dick had no knowledge to put [his]147-dick feelings in words .

' [I]146-maisie do n't know , '[146-maisie] [she]146-maisie said . ' [I]146-maisie suppose it is . '[146-maisie]

' [Maisie]146-maisie , [you]146-maisie must know . [I]146-maisie 'm[146-maisie] not supposing . '[146-maisie]

' Let 's go [home]2172-home , '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , weakly .

But [Dick]147-dick was not minded to retreat .

' [I]147-dick ca n't say things , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick pleaded , ' and [I]147-dick 'm[147-dick] awfully sorry for teasing [you]146-maisie about [Amomma]149-amomma the other day . It 's all different now , [Maisie]146-maisie , ca n't [you]146-maisie see ? And [you]146-maisie might have told [me]0-i that [you]146-maisie were going , instead of leaving [me]0-i to find out . '[146-maisie]

' [You]146-maisie did n't . [I]146-maisie did tell . Oh , [Dick]147-dick , what 's the use of worrying ? '[146-maisie]

' There is n't any ; but [we]2177-we 've been together years and years , and [I]146-maisie did n't know how much [I]146-maisie cared . '[146-maisie]

' [I]146-maisie do n't believe [you]147-dick ever did care . '[146-maisie]

' No , [I]0-i did n't ; but [I]0-i do , - [I]0-i care awfully now , [Maisie]146-maisie , '[0-i] [he]0-i gulped , - ' [Maisie]146-maisie , [darling]2178-darling , say [you]146-maisie care too , please . '[0-i]

' [I]146-maisie do , indeed [I]146-maisie do ; but it wo n't be any use . '[146-maisie]

' Why ? '[0-i]

' Because [I]146-maisie am going away . '[146-maisie]

' Yes , but if [you]147-dick promise before [you]147-dick go . Only say - will [you]147-dick ? '[0-i] A second ' [darling]2178-darling '[146-maisie] came to [his]0-i lips more easily than the first . There were few endearments in [[Dick]147-dick 's [home]2172-home]369-dick 's home or [school]340-school life ; [he]147-dick had to find [them]372-them by instinct . [Dick]147-dick caught the little hand blackened with the escaped gas of the revolver .

' [I]373-i promise , '[373-i] [she]373-i said solemnly ; ' but if [I]373-i care there is no need for promising . '[373-i]

' And do [you]147-dick care ? '[374-they] For the first time in the past few minutes [their]374-they eyes met and spoke for [them]374-they who had no skill in speech ....

' Oh , [Dick]147-dick , do n't ! Please do n't ! It was all right when [we]374-they said good - morning ; but now it 's all different ! '[149-amomma] [Amomma]149-amomma looked on from afar .

[He]149-amomma had seen [[his]149-amomma property]375-his property quarrel frequently , but [he]149-amomma had never seen kisses exchanged before . The yellow sea - poppy was wiser , and nodded its head approvingly . Considered as a kiss , that was a failure , but since it was the first , other than those demanded by duty , in all [the world]327-the world that either had ever given or taken , it opened to [them]374-they [new worlds]377-new worlds , and every one of [them]377-new worlds glorious , so that [they]374-they were lifted above the consideration of any worlds at all , especially those in which tea is necessary , and sat still , holding [each other]339-each other 's hands and saying not a word .

' [You]146-maisie ca n't forget now , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , at last . There was that on [his]147-dick cheek that stung more than gunpowder .

' [I]146-maisie should n't have forgotten anyhow , '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , and [they]374-they looked at [each other]339-each other and saw that [each]380-each was changed from the companion of an hour ago to a wonder and a mystery [they]374-they could not understand . The sun began to set , and a night - wind thrashed along the bents of [the foreshore]381-the foreshore .

' [We]374-they shall be awfully late for tea , '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie . ' Let 's go [home]2172-home . '[146-maisie]

' Let 's use the rest of the cartridges first , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick ; and [he]147-dick helped [Maisie]146-maisie down [the slope of [the fort]383-the fort]382-the slope of the fort to [the sea]2168-the sea , - a descent that [she]146-maisie was quite capable of covering at full speed . Equally gravely [Maisie]146-maisie took the grimy hand . [Dick]147-dick bent forward clumsily ; [Maisie]146-maisie drew the hand away , and [Dick]147-dick blushed .

' It 's very pretty , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick said .

' Pooh ! '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , with a little laugh of gratified vanity . [She]146-maisie stood close to [Dick]147-dick as [he]147-dick loaded the revolver for the last time and fired over [the sea]2168-the sea with a vague notion at the back of [his]147-dick head that [he]147-dick was protecting [Maisie]146-maisie from all the evils in [the world]327-the world . A puddle far across [the mud]387-the mud caught the last rays of the sun and turned into a wrathful red disc . The light held [Dick]147-dick 's attention for a moment , and as [he]147-dick raised [his]147-dick revolver there fell upon [him]147-dick a renewed sense of the miraculous , in that [he]147-dick was standing by [Maisie]146-maisie who had promised to care for [him]147-dick for an indefinite length of time till such date as - - A gust of the growing wind drove [the girl]345-the girl 's long black hair across [his]147-dick face as [she]146-maisie stood with [her]146-maisie hand on [his]147-dick shoulder calling [Amomma]149-amomma ' a little beast , '[146-maisie] and for a moment [he]147-dick was in the dark , - a darkness that stung . The bullet went singing out to [the empty sea]389-the empty sea .

' Spoilt [my]147-dick aim , '[147-dick] said [he]147-dick , shaking [his]147-dick head . ' There are n't any more cartridges ; [we]390-they shall have to run [home]2172-home . '[147-dick] But [they]390-they did not run . [They]390-they walked very slowly , arm in arm . And it was a matter of indifference to [them]390-they whether [the neglected [Amomma]149-amomma with two pin - fire cartridges in [his]149-amomma inside]391-the neglected amomma with two pin - fire cartridges in his inside blew up or trotted beside [them]390-they ; for [they]390-they had come into a golden heritage and were disposing of it with all the wisdom of all [their]390-they years .

' And [I]147-dick shall be - - '[147-dick] quoth [Dick]147-dick , valiantly . Then [he]147-dick checked [himself]147-dick : ' [I]147-dick do n't know what [I]147-dick shall be . [I]147-dick do n't seem to be able to pass any exams , but [I]147-dick can make awful caricatures of [the masters]2182-the masters . Ho ! Ho ! '[147-dick]

' Be [an artist]2183-an artist , then , '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie . ' [You]147-dick 're[146-maisie] always laughing at [my]0-i trying to draw ; and it will do [you]147-dick good . '[146-maisie]

' [I]147-dick 'll never laugh at anything [you]146-maisie do , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick answered . ' [I]147-dick 'll be [an artist]2183-an artist , and [I]147-dick 'll do things . '[147-dick]

' [Artists]2185-artists always want money , do n't [they]2185-artists ? '[146-maisie]

' [I]147-dick 've got a hundred and twenty pounds a year of [my]147-dick own . [[My]147-dick guardians]2186-my guardians tell [me]147-dick [I]147-dick 'm[147-dick] to have it when [I]0-i come of age . That will be enough to begin with . '[147-dick]

' Ah , [I]146-maisie 'm[146-maisie] rich , ' said [Maisie]146-maisie . '[146-maisie] [I]0-i 've got three hundred a year all [my]0-i own when [I]0-i 'm twenty - one . That 's why [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett is kinder to [me]147-dick than [she]148-mrs. jennett is to [you]147-dick . [I]147-dick wish , though , that [I]147-dick had [somebody that belonged to [me]147-dick]2187-somebody that belonged to me , - just [a father]2188-a father or [a mother]2189-a mother . '[147-dick]

' [You]392-you belong to [me]147-dick , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , ' for ever and ever . '[147-dick]

' Yes , [we]393-we belong - for ever . It 's very nice . '[392-you] [She]392-you squeezed [his]147-dick arm . The kindly darkness hid [them]393-we both , and , emboldened because [he]147-dick could only just see the profile of [Maisie]146-maisie 's cheek with the long lashes veiling the gray eyes , [Dick]147-dick at the front door delivered [himself]147-dick of the words [he]147-dick had been boggling over for the last two hours .

' And [I]147-dick - love [you]146-maisie , [Maisie]146-maisie , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick said , in a whisper that seemed to [him]147-dick to ring across [the world]327-the world , - [the world that [he]147-dick would to - morrow or the next day set out to conquer]395-the world that he would to - morrow or the next day set out to conquer .

There was a scene , not , for the sake of discipline , to be reported , when [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett would have fallen upon [him]147-dick , first for disgraceful unpunctuality , and secondly for nearly killing [himself]147-dick with a forbidden weapon .

' [I]147-dick was playing with it , and it went off by itself , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , when the powder - pocked cheek could no longer be hidden , ' but if [you]148-mrs. jennett think [you]148-mrs. jennett 're[147-dick] going to lick [me]0-i [you]148-mrs. jennett 're wrong . [You]148-mrs. jennett are never going to touch [me]147-dick again .[147-dick]

Sit down and give [me]0-i [my]0-i tea . [You]148-mrs. jennett ca n't cheat [us]396-us out of that , anyhow . '[148-mrs. jennett]

[Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett gasped and became livid . [Maisie]146-maisie said nothing , but encouraged [Dick]147-dick with [her]146-maisie eyes , and [he]147-dick behaved abominably all that evening . [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett prophesied an immediate judgment of [Providence]151-providence and a descent into [Tophet]4-tophet later , but [Dick]147-dick walked in [Paradise]5-paradise and would not hear . Only when [he]147-dick was going to bed [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett recovered and asserted [herself]148-mrs. jennett . [He]147-dick had bidden [Maisie]146-maisie good - night with down - dropped eyes and from a distance .

' If [you]147-dick are n't [a gentleman]2190-a gentleman [you]147-dick might try to behave like one , '[148-mrs. jennett] said [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett , spitefully . ' [You]147-dick 've been quarrelling with [Maisie]146-maisie again . '[148-mrs. jennett]

This meant that the usual good - night kiss had been omitted . [Maisie]146-maisie , white to the lips , thrust [her]146-maisie cheek forward with a fine air of indifference , and was duly pecked by [Dick]147-dick , who tramped out of [the room]397-the room red as fire . That night [he]147-dick dreamed a wild dream . [He]147-dick had won all [the world]327-the world and brought it to [Maisie]146-maisie in a cartridge - box , but [she]146-maisie turned it over with [her]146-maisie foot , and , instead of saying ' Thank [you]147-dick , '[146-maisie] cried - ' Where is the grass collar [you]147-dick promised for [Amomma]149-amomma ? Oh , how selfish [you]147-dick are ! '[146-maisie]

CHAPTER II

Then [we]399-we brought the lances down , then the bugles blew , When [we]399-we went to [Kandahar]6-kandahar , ridin ' two an '[146-maisie] two , Ridin ' , ridin '[146-maisie] , ridin ' , two an '[146-maisie] two , [Ta - ra - ra - ra - ra - ra - ra]7-ta - ra - ra - ra - ra - ra - ra , All the way to [Kandahar]6-kandahar , ridin ' two an '[146-maisie] two .

- [Barrack - Room Ballad]8-barrack - room ballad . ' [I'M]2191-i'm NOT angry with [the British public]2192-the british public , but [I]146-maisie wish [we]399-we had a few thousand of [them]2192-the british public scattered among [these rooks]2193-these rooks . [They]2192-the british public would n't be in such a hurry to get at [their]2192-the british public morning papers then . ' [I]146-maisie 'll lend [you]147-dick a packing - needle for six square inches of it then . Both [my]146-maisie knees are worn through . '[146-maisie]

[I]0-i do n't think there 's enough to protect [my]0-i royal body from the cold blast as it is . What are [you]0-i doing with that everlasting sketch - book of [yours]0-i , [Dick]147-dick ? '[0-i]

' [Study of [[our]2200-our Special Correspondent]2201-our special correspondent repairing [his]2201-our special correspondent wardrobe]2199-study of our special correspondent repairing his wardrobe , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , gravely , as [the other man]400-the other man kicked off a pair of sorely worn riding - breeches and began to fit a square of coarse canvas over the most obvious open space . [He]400-the other man grunted disconsolately as the vastness of the void developed itself .

' Sugar - bags , indeed ! Hi ! [[you]400-the other man pilot man]2202-you pilot man there ! lend [me]400-the other man all the sails for [that whale - boat]2203-that whale - boat . '[400-the other man]

A fez - crowned head bobbed up in the stern - sheets , divided itself into exact halves with one flashing grin , and bobbed down again . [The man of the tattered breeches , clad only in a Norfolk jacket and a gray flannel shirt]401-the man of the tattered breeches , clad only in a norfolk jacket and a gray flannel shirt , went on with [his]401-the man of the tattered breeches , clad only in a norfolk jacket and a gray flannel shirt clumsy sewing , while [Dick]147-dick chuckled over the sketch .

Some twenty [whale - boats]402-whale - boats were nuzzling [a sand - bank]403-a sand - bank which was dotted with [English soldiery of half a dozen corps]404-english soldiery of half a dozen corps , bathing or washing [their]404-english soldiery of half a dozen corps clothes . A heap of boat - rollers , commissariat - boxes , sugar - bags , and flour- and small - arm - ammunition - cases showed where one of [the whale - boats]405-the whale - boats had been compelled to unload hastily ; and [a regimental carpenter]406-a regimental carpenter was swearing aloud as [he]406-a regimental carpenter tried , on a wholly insufficient allowance of white lead , to plaster up the sun - parched gaping seams of [the boat]407-the boat [herself]407-the boat .

' First the bloomin '[406-a regimental carpenter] rudder snaps , ' said [he]400-the other man to [the world]327-the world in general ; '[406-a regimental carpenter] then the mast goes ; an ' then , s '[406-a regimental carpenter] ' help [me]406-a regimental carpenter , when [she]407-the boat ca n't do nothin' else , [she]407-the boat opens '[406-a regimental carpenter] erself out like a cock - eyes Chinese lotus . '[406-a regimental carpenter]

' Exactly the case with [my]408-the tailor breeches , whoever [you]400-the other man are , '[408-the tailor] said [the tailor]408-the tailor , without looking up . ' [Dick]147-dick , [I]408-the tailor wonder when [I]408-the tailor shall see [a decent shop]2205-a decent shop again . '[408-the tailor]

There was no answer , save the incessant angry murmur of [the Nile]409-the nile as it raced round a basalt - walled bend and foamed across [a rock - ridge half a mile upstream]410-a rock - ridge half a mile upstream . It was as though the brown weight of [the river]411-the river would drive [the white men]412-the white men back to [[their]412-the white men own country]413-their own country . The indescribable scent of Nile mud in the air told that [the stream]414-the stream was falling and the next few miles would be no light thing for [the whale - boats]405-the whale - boats to overpass . [The desert]416-the desert ran down almost to [the banks]417-the banks , where , among [gray , red , and black hillocks]418-gray , red , and black hillocks , [a camel - corps]419-a camel - corps was encamped . [No man]420-no man dared even for a day lose touch of [the slow - moving boats]421-the slow - moving boats ; there had been no fighting for weeks past , and throughout all that time [the Nile]9-the nile had never spared [them]412-the white men . [Rapid]152-rapid had followed rapid , rock rock , and [island - group island - group]422-island - group island - group , till the rank and file had long since lost all count of direction and very nearly of time . [They]412-the white men were moving somewhere , [they]412-the white men did not know why , to do something , [they]412-the white men did not know what . Before [them]412-the white men lay [the Nile]9-the nile , and at the other end of it was one [Gordon]153-gordon , fighting for the dear life , in [a town called [Khartoum]10-khartoum]423-a town called khartoum . There were [columns of [British troops]425-british troops in [the desert]416-the desert]424-columns of british troops in the desert , or in [one of the many deserts]427-one of the many deserts ; there were yet more columns waiting to embark on [the river]411-the river ; there were fresh drafts waiting at [Assioot]11-assioot and [Assuan]12-assuan ; there were lies and rumours running over the face of [the hopeless land]429-the hopeless land from [Suakin]13-suakin to [the Sixth Cataract]14-the sixth cataract , and [men]430-men supposed generally that there must be [some one in authority to direct the general scheme of the many movements]431-some one in authority to direct the general scheme of the many movements . The duty of [that particular river - column]432-that particular river - column was to keep [the whale - boats]405-the whale - boats afloat in [the water]434-the water , to avoid trampling on [the villagers]435-the villagers ' crops when [the gangs]2206-the gangs '[436-the soldiers] tracked ' [the boats]2207-the boats with lines thrown from midstream , to get as much sleep and food as was possible , and , above all , to press on without delay in the teeth of [the churning Nile]9-the nile .[436-the soldiers]

With [the soldiers]436-the soldiers sweated and toiled [the correspondents of the newspapers]437-the correspondents of the newspapers , and [they]436-the soldiers were almost as ignorant as [[their]436-the soldiers companions]438-their companions . But it was above all things necessary that [England]18-england at breakfast should be amused and thrilled and interested , whether [Gordon]153-gordon lived or died , or half [the British army]439-the british army went to pieces in [the sands]440-the sands . The Soudan campaign was a picturesque one , and lent itself to vivid word - painting . Now and again [a ' Special ']2208-a ' special '[2208-a ' special '] managed to get slain , - which was not altogether a disadvantage to the paper that employed [him]153-gordon , - and more often the hand - to - hand nature of the fighting allowed of miraculous escapes which were worth telegraphing [home]2172-home at eighteenpence the word . There were [many correspondents with many corps and columns]442-many correspondents with many corps and columns , - from [the veterans who had followed on the heels of the cavalry that occupied [Cairo]16-cairo in ' 82]2209-the veterans who had followed on the heels of the cavalry that occupied cairo in ' 82 , what time [Arabi Pasha]155-arabi pasha called [himself]155-arabi pasha [king , who had seen the first miserable work round]2210-king , who had seen the first miserable work round [Suakin]13-suakin when [the sentries]2211-the sentries were cut up nightly and [the scrub swarmed with spears]2212-the scrub swarmed with spears , to [youngsters]2213-youngsters jerked into the business at the end of a telegraph - wire to take the places of [[their]2213-youngsters betters killed or invalided]2214-their betters killed or invalided .[443-the seniors]

Among [the seniors]443-the seniors - [those who knew every shift and change in the perplexing postal arrangements]444-those who knew every shift and change in the perplexing postal arrangements , the value of [the seediest , weediest Egyptian garron offered for sale in [Cairo]16-cairo or [Alexandria]17-alexandria , who could talk [a telegraph - clerk]446-a telegraph - clerk into amiability and soothe the ruffled vanity of [a newly appointed staff - officer]447-a newly appointed staff - officer when press regulations became burdensome]445-the seediest , weediest egyptian garron offered for sale in cairo or alexandria , who could talk a telegraph - clerk into amiability and soothe the ruffled vanity of a newly appointed staff - officer when press regulations became burdensome - was [the man in the flannel shirt]448-the man in the flannel shirt , [the black - browed [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow]449-the black - browed torpenhow . [He]156-torpenhow represented [the Central Southern Syndicate in the campaign]450-the central southern syndicate in the campaign , as [he]156-torpenhow had represented [it]450-the central southern syndicate in the campaign in the Egyptian war , and elsewhere . [The syndicate]312-the syndicate did not concern [itself]312-the syndicate greatly with criticisms of attack and the like . [It]312-the syndicate supplied [the masses]452-the masses , and all it demanded was picturesqueness and abundance of detail ; for there is more joy in [England]18-england over [a soldier who insubordinately steps out of square to rescue [a comrade]454-a comrade]453-a soldier who insubordinately steps out of square to rescue a comrade than [over twenty generals slaving even to baldness at the gross details of transport and commissariat]455-over twenty generals slaving even to baldness at the gross details of transport and commissariat .

[He]156-torpenhow had met at [Suakin]13-suakin [a young man]456-a young man , sitting on the edge of [a recently abandoned redoubt about the size of a hat - box]457-a recently abandoned redoubt about the size of a hat - box , sketching a clump of shell - torn bodies on [the gravel plain]458-the gravel plain .

' What are [you]456-a young man for ? '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow . The greeting of [the correspondent]459-the correspondent is that of [the commercial traveller on [the road]461-the road]460-the commercial traveller on the road .

' [My]462-the young man own hand , '[462-the young man] said [the young man]462-the young man , without looking up . ' Have [you]456-a young man any tobacco ? '[462-the young man]

[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow waited till the sketch was finished , and when [he]156-torpenhow had looked at it said , ' What 's [your]456-a young man business here ? '[156-torpenhow]

' Nothing ; there was a row , so [I]462-the young man came . ' [You]456-a young man 've cheek enough to build [a redoubt]2217-a redoubt with , '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , and took stock of [the new acquaintance]464-the new acquaintance . ' Do [you]456-a young man always draw like that ? '[156-torpenhow]

[The young man]462-the young man produced more sketches . ' Row on [a Chinese pig - boat]2218-a chinese pig - boat , '[462-the young man] said [he]462-the young man , sententiously , showing [them]466-them one after another . - ' [Chief mate]2219-chief mate dirked by [a comprador]2220-a comprador . - [Junk ashore off [Hakodate]19-hakodate]2221-junk ashore off hakodate . - [Somali muleteer]2222-somali muleteer being flogged . - Star - shelled bursting over camp at [Berbera]20-berbera . - [Slave - dhow]2223-slave - dhow being chased round [Tajurrah Bah]21-tajurrah bah . - [Soldier]2224-soldier lying dead in the moonlight outside [Suakin]13-suakin . - throat cut by Fuzzies . '[462-the young man]

' H'm ! '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , ' ca n't say [I]156-torpenhow care for Verestchagin - and - water [myself]156-torpenhow , but there 's no accounting for tastes . Doing anything now , are [you]156-torpenhow ? '[156-torpenhow]

' No . [I]462-the young man 'm[462-the young man] amusing [myself]0-i here . '[462-the young man]

[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow looked at the sketches again , and nodded . ' Yes , [you]0-i 're[156-torpenhow] right to take [your]0-i first chance when [you]0-i can get it . '[156-torpenhow]

[He]156-torpenhow rode away swiftly through [the Gate of [the Two War - Ships]468-the two war - ships]467-the gate of the two war - ships , rattled across [the causeway]469-the causeway into [the town]470-the town , and wired to [[his]156-torpenhow syndicate]471-his syndicate , ' [Got man]2225-got man [here]2226-here , picture - work . Good and cheap . Shall [I]156-torpenhow arrange ? Will do letterpress with sketches . '[156-torpenhow]

[The man on the redoubt]472-the man on the redoubt sat swinging [his]472-the man on the redoubt legs and murmuring , ' [I]472-the man on the redoubt knew the chance would come , sooner or later . By [Gad]157-gad , [they]471-his syndicate 'll have to sweat for it if [I]472-the man on the redoubt come through this business alive ! '[472-the man on the redoubt]

In the evening [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow was able to announce to [[his]156-torpenhow friend]473-his friend that [the Central Southern Agency]474-the central southern agency was willing to take [him]156-torpenhow on trial , paying expenses for three months . ' And , by the way , what 's [your]156-torpenhow name ? '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow .

' [Heldar]147-dick . Do [they]471-his syndicate give [me]156-torpenhow a free hand ? '[156-torpenhow]

' [They]471-his syndicate 've taken [you]475-you on chance . [You]475-you must justify the choice . [You]475-you 'd better stick to [me]156-torpenhow . [I]156-torpenhow 'm[156-torpenhow] going up - country with a column , and [I]0-i 'll do what [I]0-i can for [you]475-you . Give [me]0-i some of [your]475-you sketches taken [here]2226-here , and [I]0-i 'll send ['em]2227-'em along . '[0-i] To [himself]0-i [he]0-i said , ' That 's the best bargain [the Central southern]2228-the central southern has ever made ; and [they]2228-the central southern got [me]0-i cheaply enough . '[0-i]

So it came to pass that , after some purchase of horse - flesh and arrangements financial and political , [Dick]147-dick was made free of [the New and Honourable Fraternity of [war correspondents]478-war correspondents]477-the new and honourable fraternity of war correspondents , who all possess the inalienable right of doing as much work as [they]477-the new and honourable fraternity of war correspondents can and getting as much for it as [Providence]151-providence and [[their]477-the new and honourable fraternity of war correspondents owners]479-their owners shall please . To these things are added in time , if [the brother]480-the brother be worthy , the power of glib speech that [neither man]481-neither man nor [woman]482-woman can resist when a meal or a bed is in question , the eye of [a horse - cope]483-a horse - cope , the skill of [a cook]484-a cook , the constitution of a bullock , the digestion of an ostrich , and an infinite adaptability to all circumstances . But many die before [they]485-they attain to this degree , and [the past - masters in the craft appear for the most part in dress - clothes when [they]486-the past - masters in the craft appear for the most part in dress - clothes when they are in england are in [England]18-england]486-the past - masters in the craft appear for the most part in dress - clothes when they are in england , and thus [their]486-the past - masters in the craft appear for the most part in dress - clothes when they are in england glory is hidden from the multitude .

[Dick]147-dick followed [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow wherever [the latter]487-the latter 's fancy chose to lead [him]156-torpenhow , and between the two [they]488-they managed to accomplish some work that almost satisfied [themselves]488-they . It was not an easy life in any way , and under [its]489-its influence [the two]490-the two were drawn very closely together , for [they]488-they ate from the same dish , [they]488-they shared the same water - bottle , and , most binding tie of all , [their]488-they mails went off together . It was [Dick]147-dick who managed to make gloriously drunk [a telegraph - clerk]446-a telegraph - clerk in [a palm hut far beyond the Second Cataract]492-a palm hut far beyond the second cataract , and , while [the man]493-the man lay in bliss on the floor , possessed [himself]493-the man of some laboriously acquired exclusive information , forwarded by [a confiding correspondent of [an opposition syndicate]495-an opposition syndicate]494-a confiding correspondent of an opposition syndicate , made a careful duplicate of the matter , and brought the result to [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , who said that all was fair in love or war correspondence , and built an excellent descriptive article from [[his]156-torpenhow rival]496-his rival 's riotous waste of words . It was [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow who - but the tale of [their]488-they adventures , together and apart , from [Philae]22-philae to [the waste wilderness of [Herawi]23-herawi and [Muella]24-muella]497-the waste wilderness of herawi and muella , would fill many books . [They]488-they had been penned into a square side by side , in deadly fear of being shot by [over - excited soldiers]498-over - excited soldiers ; [they]488-they had fought with baggage - camels in the chill dawn ; [they]488-they had jogged along in silence under blinding sun on [indefatigable little Egyptian horses]499-indefatigable little egyptian horses ; and [they]488-they had floundered on [the shallows of [the Nile]9-the nile]500-the shallows of the nile when [the whale - boat]501-the whale - boat in which [they]488-they had found [a berth]502-a berth chose to hit a hidden rock and rip out half her bottom - planks .

Now [they]488-they were sitting on [the sand - bank]503-the sand - bank , and [the whale - boats]405-the whale - boats were bringing up the remainder of the column .

' Yes , '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , as [he]156-torpenhow put the last rude stitches into [his]156-torpenhow over - long - neglected gear , ' it has been a beautiful business . '[156-torpenhow]

' The patch or the campaign ? '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick . ' Do n't think much of either , [myself]147-dick . '[147-dick]

' [You]156-torpenhow want [the Euryalus]25-the euryalus brought up above [the Third Cataract]26-the third cataract , do n't [you]156-torpenhow ? and eighty - one - ton guns at [Jakdul]27-jakdul ? A bugle blew furiously , and [the men on the bank]506-the men on the bank hurried to [their]506-the men on the bank arms and accoutrements .

' " [Pisan soldiery]2231-pisan soldiery surprised while bathing , " '[147-dick] remarked [Dick]147-dick , calmly .

[The camel - corps on the bank]507-the camel - corps on the bank yelled to [the infantry]508-the infantry to come to [them]507-the camel - corps on the bank , and a hoarse shouting down [the river]411-the river showed that [the remainder of the column]510-the remainder of the column had wind of the trouble and was hastening to take share in it . As swiftly as [a reach of still water]511-a reach of still water is crisped by the wind , [the rock - strewn ridges]512-the rock - strewn ridges and [scrub - topped hills]513-scrub - topped hills were troubled and alive with [armed men]514-armed men .

Mercifully , it occurred to [these]515-these to stand far off for a time , to shout and gesticulate joyously . [One man]516-one man even delivered [himself]516-one man of a long story . [The camel - corps]505-the camel - corps did not fire . [They]505-the camel - corps were only too glad of a little breathing - space , until some sort of square could be formed . [The men on [the sand - bank]503-the sand - bank]518-the men on the sand - bank ran to [their]518-the men on the sand - bank side ; and [the whale - boats]405-the whale - boats , as [they]405-the whale - boats toiled up within shouting distance , were thrust into the nearest bank and emptied of all save [the sick and a few men]521-the sick and a few men to guard [them]405-the whale - boats . [The Arab orator]522-the arab orator ceased [his]522-the arab orator outcries , and [[his]522-the arab orator friends]523-his friends howled .

' [They]505-the camel - corps look like [[the Mahdi]160-the mahdi 's men]2235-the mahdi 's men , '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , elbowing [himself]156-torpenhow into the crush of [the square]524-the square ; ' but what thousands of 'em[156-torpenhow] there are ! [The tribes hereabout]525-the tribes hereabout are n't against [us]526-us , [I]0-i know . '[0-i]

' Then [the Mahdi]160-the mahdi 's taken [another town]2236-another town , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , ' and set [all these yelping devils]2237-all these yelping devils free to show [us]526-us up . Lend [us]526-us [your]526-us glass . '[147-dick]

' [[Our]526-us scouts]2238-our scouts should have told [us]526-us of this . [We]526-us 've been trapped , '[527-a subaltern] said [a subaltern]527-a subaltern . ' Are n't the camel guns ever going to begin ? Hurry up , [[you]526-us men]2239-you men ! '[527-a subaltern]

There was no need of any order . [The men]528-the men flung [themselves]528-the men panting against the sides of [the square]524-the square , for [they]528-the men had good reason to know that [whoso was left outside when the fighting began]530-whoso was left outside when the fighting began would very probably die in an extremely unpleasant fashion . [The little hundred - and - fifty - pound camel - guns]531-the little hundred - and - fifty - pound camel - guns posted at one corner of [the square]524-the square opened the ball as [the square]524-the square moved forward by its right to get possession of [a knoll of rising ground]534-a knoll of rising ground . [All]535-all had fought in this manner many times before , and there was no novelty in the entertainment ; always the same hot and stifling formation , the smell of dust and leather , the same boltlike rush of [the enemy , the same pressure on the weakest side]536-the enemy , the same pressure on the weakest side , the few minutes of hand - to - hand scuffle , and then the silence of [the desert]416-the desert , broken only by the yells of those whom [[their]528-the men handful of cavalry]538-their handful of cavalry attempted to purse . [They]528-the men had become careless . The camel - guns spoke at intervals , and [the square]524-the square slouched forward amid the protesting of the camels . Then came the attack of [three thousand men who had not learned from books]540-three thousand men who had not learned from books that it is impossible for [troops in close order to attack against breech - loading fire]541-troops in close order to attack against breech - loading fire .

A few dropping shots heralded [their]528-the men approach , and [a few horsemen]542-a few horsemen led , but [the bulk of [the force]544-the force]543-the bulk of the force was naked humanity , mad with rage , and armed with the spear and the sword . The instinct of [the desert]416-the desert , where there is always much war , told [them]528-the men that the right flank of [the square]524-the square was the weakest , for [they]528-the men swung clear of the front . The camel - guns shelled [them]528-the men as [they]528-the men passed and opened for an instant lanes through [their]528-the men midst , most like those quick - closing vistas in [a Kentish hop - garden]547-a kentish hop - garden seen when [the train races by]548-the train races by at full speed ; and the infantry fire , held till the opportune moment , dropped [them]528-the men in close - packing hundreds . [No civilised troops in [the world]327-the world]549-no civilised troops in the world could have endured the hell through which [they]528-the men came , [the living]551-the living leaping high to avoid [the dying who clutched at [their]551-the living heels]552-the dying who clutched at their heels , [the wounded cursing and staggering forward]553-the wounded cursing and staggering forward , till [they]528-the men fell - a torrent black as the sliding water above [a mill - dam]554-a mill - dam - full on [the right flank of [the square]524-the square]555-the right flank of the square .

Then the line of [the dusty troops]557-the dusty troops and the faint blue desert sky overhead went out in rolling smoke , and the little stones on the heated ground and the tinder - dry clumps of scrub became matters of surpassing interest , for [men]430-men measured [their]430-men agonised retreat and recovery by these things , counting mechanically and hewing [their]430-men way back to chosen pebble and branch . There was no semblance of any concerted fighting . For [aught]559-aught [the men]528-the men knew , [the enemy]561-the enemy might be attempting all four sides of [the square]524-the square at once . [Their]528-the men business was to destroy what lay in front of [them]528-the men , to bayonet in the back [those who passed over [them]528-the men]563-those who passed over them , and , dying , to drag down [the slayer]564-the slayer till [he]564-the slayer could be knocked on the head by some avenging gun - butt .

[Dick]147-dick waited with [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow and [a young doctor]565-a young doctor till the stress grew unendurable . It was hopeless to attend to [the wounded]566-the wounded till the attack was repulsed , so [the three]567-the three moved forward gingerly towards the weakest side of [the square]524-the square . There was a rush from without , the short hough - hough of the stabbing spears , and [a man on a horse , followed by [thirty or forty others]570-thirty or forty others]569-a man on a horse , followed by thirty or forty others , dashed through , yelling and hacking . The right flank of [the square]524-the square sucked in after [them]528-the men , and the other sides sent help . [The wounded , who knew that [they]566-the wounded had but a few hours more to live , caught at [the enemy]561-the enemy 's feet and brought [them]566-the wounded down , or , staggering into a discarded rifle , fired blindly into the scuffle that raged in the centre of [the square]524-the square]572-the wounded , who knew that they had but a few hours more to live , caught at the enemy 's feet and brought them down , or , staggering into a discarded rifle , fired blindly into the scuffle that raged in the centre of the square .

[Dick]147-dick was conscious that [somebody]575-somebody had cut [him]147-dick violently across [his]147-dick helmet , that [he]147-dick had fired [his]147-dick revolver into a black , foam - flecked face which forthwith ceased to bear any resemblance to a face , and that [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow had gone down under [an Arab whom [he]156-torpenhow had tried to ' collar low , '[579-the doctor] and was turning over and over with [[his]156-torpenhow captive]577-his captive , feeling for [the man]493-the man 's eyes]576-an arab whom he had tried to ' collar low , ' and was turning over and over with his captive , feeling for the man 's eyes . [The doctor]579-the doctor jabbed at a venture with a bayonet , and [a helmetless soldier]580-a helmetless soldier fired over [Dick]147-dick 's shoulder : the flying grains of powder stung [his]147-dick cheek . It was to [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow that [Dick]147-dick turned by instinct . [The representative of [the Central Southern Syndicate]582-the central southern syndicate]581-the representative of the central southern syndicate had shaken [himself]581-the representative of the central southern syndicate clear of [[his]581-the representative of the central southern syndicate enemy]583-his enemy , and rose , wiping [his]581-the representative of the central southern syndicate thumb on [his]581-the representative of the central southern syndicate trousers . [The Arab]584-the arab , both hands to [his]584-the arab forehead , screamed aloud , then snatched up [his]584-the arab spear and rushed at [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , who was panting under shelter of [Dick]147-dick 's revolver . [Dick]147-dick fired twice , and [the man]493-the man dropped limply . [His]493-the man upturned face lacked one eye . The musketry - fire redoubled , but cheers mingled with it . The rush had failed and [the enemy]561-the enemy were flying . If the heart of [the square]524-the square were shambles , the ground beyond was [a butcher 's shop]588-a butcher 's shop . [Dick]147-dick thrust [his]147-dick way forward between [the maddened men]589-the maddened men . [The remnant of the enemy]590-the remnant of the enemy were retiring , as [the few - the very few - English cavalry]591-the few - the very few - english cavalry rode down [the laggards]592-the laggards .

Beyond the lines of the dead , a broad blood - stained Arab spear cast aside in the retreat lay across [a stump of scrub]593-a stump of scrub , and beyond this again the illimitable dark levels of [the desert]416-the desert . The sun caught the steel and turned it into a red disc . [Some one behind [him]493-the man]595-some one behind him was saying , ' Ah , get away , [[you]147-dick brute]2240-you brute ! '[147-dick] [Dick]147-dick raised [his]147-dick revolver and pointed towards [the desert]416-the desert . [His]147-dick eye was held by the red splash in the distance , and the clamour about [him]493-the man seemed to die down to a very far - away whisper , like the whisper of [a level sea]597-a level sea . There was the revolver and the red light .... and the voice of [some one scaring something away , exactly as had fallen somewhere before]598-some one scaring something away , exactly as had fallen somewhere before , - a darkness that stung . [He]147-dick fired at random , and the bullet went out across [the desert]416-the desert as [he]147-dick muttered , ' Spoilt [my]147-dick aim . There are n't any more cartridges . [We]2241-we shall have to run [home]2172-home . '[147-dick] [He]147-dick put [his]147-dick hand to [his]147-dick head and brought it away covered with blood .

' [Old man]2243-old man , [you]147-dick 're[147-dick] cut rather badly , ' said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow . '[147-dick] [I]0-i owe [you]147-dick something for this business . Thanks . Stand up ! [I]0-i say , [you]147-dick ca n't be ill here . '[0-i]

Throughout the night , when [the troops]600-the troops were encamped by [the whale - boats]405-the whale - boats , [a black figure]602-a black figure danced in the strong moonlight on [the sand - bar]603-the sand - bar and shouted that [Khartoum]10-khartoum [the accursed one]604-the accursed one was dead , - was dead , - was dead , - that two steamers were rock - staked on [the Nile]9-the nile outside [the city]605-the city , and that of all [[their]606-their crews]607-their crews there remained not one ; and [Khartoum]10-khartoum was dead , - was dead , - was dead !

But [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow took no heed . [He]156-torpenhow was watching [Dick]147-dick , who called aloud to [the restless Nile]9-the nile for [Maisie]146-maisie , - and again [Maisie]146-maisie !

' Behold a phenomenon , '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , rearranging the blanket . ' Here is a man , presumably human , who mentions the name of [one woman]2244-one woman only . And [I]156-torpenhow 've seen a good deal of delirium , too . - [Dick]147-dick , here 's some fizzy drink . '[156-torpenhow]

' Thank [you]156-torpenhow , [Maisie]146-maisie , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick .

CHAPTER III

So [he]608-he thinks [he]608-he shall take to [the sea]2168-the sea again For one more cruise with [[his]608-he buccaneers]610-his buccaneers , To singe the beard of [the King of [Spain]30-spain]611-the king of spain , And capture [another Dean of [Jaen]31-jaen]612-another dean of jaen And sell [him]612-another dean of jaen in [Algiers]32-algiers . - [A Dutch Picture]613-a dutch picture . - Longfellow THE SOUDAN campaign and [Dick]147-dick 's broken head had been some months ended and mended , and [the Central Southern Syndicate]582-the central southern syndicate had paid [Dick]147-dick a certain sum on account for work done , which work [they]582-the central southern syndicate were careful to assure [him]147-dick was not altogether up to [their]582-the central southern syndicate standard . [Dick]147-dick heaved the letter into [the Nile]9-the nile at [Cairo]16-cairo , cashed the draft in [the same town]615-the same town , and bade a warm farewell to [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow at [the station]616-the station .

' [I]156-torpenhow am going to lie up for a while and rest , '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow . ' [I]156-torpenhow do n't know where [I]156-torpenhow shall live in [London]33-london , but if [God]161-god brings [us]617-us to meet , [we]617-us shall meet .[156-torpenhow]

Are [you]156-torpenhow starying here on the off - chance of another row ? There will be none till [the Southern Soudan]34-the southern soudan is reoccupied by [[our]617-us troops]618-our troops . Mark that .

Good - bye ; bless [you]156-torpenhow ; come back when [your]156-torpenhow money 's spent ; and give [me]0-i [your]156-torpenhow address . '[156-torpenhow]

[Dick]147-dick loitered in [Cairo]16-cairo , [Alexandria]17-alexandria , [Ismailia]35-ismailia , and [Port Said]36-port said , - especially [Port Said]36-port said . There is iniquity in [many parts of [the world]327-the world]619-many parts of the world , and vice in all , but the concentrated essence of all the iniquities and all the vices in [all the continents]621-all the continents finds itself at [Port Said]36-port said . And through the heart of [that sand - bordered hell , where the mirage flickers day long above [the Bitter Lake]37-the bitter lake]622-that sand - bordered hell , where the mirage flickers day long above the bitter lake , move , if [you]156-torpenhow will only wait , most of [the men and women [you]156-torpenhow have known in this life]623-the men and women you have known in this life . [Dick]147-dick established [himself]147-dick in quarters more riotous than respectable . [He]147-dick spent [his]147-dick evenings on [the quay]624-the quay , and boarded [many ships]625-many ships , and saw [very many friends]626-very many friends , - [gracious Englishwomen with whom [he]147-dick had talked not too wisely in [the veranda of [Shepherd 's Hotel]629-shepherd 's hotel]628-the veranda of shepherd 's hotel]627-gracious englishwomen with whom he had talked not too wisely in the veranda of shepherd 's hotel , [hurrying war correspondents]630-hurrying war correspondents , skippers of [the contract troop - ships employed in the campaign]631-the contract troop - ships employed in the campaign , [army officers by the score]632-army officers by the score , and [others of less reputable trades]633-others of less reputable trades .

[He]147-dick had choice of [all the races of [the East and West]38-the east and west]634-all the races of the east and west for studies , and the advantage of seeing [[his]147-dick subjects]635-his subjects under the influence of strong excitement , at the gaming - tables , [saloons]636-saloons , [dancing - hells]637-dancing - hells , and [elsewhere]638-elsewhere . For recreation there was the straight vista of [the Canal]639-the canal , [the blazing sands]640-the blazing sands , the procession of shipping , and [the white hospitals where [the English soldiers]642-the english soldiers lay]641-the white hospitals where the english soldiers lay . [He]147-dick strove to set down in black and white and colour all that [Providence]151-providence sent [him]147-dick , and when that supply was ended sought about for fresh material . It was a fascinating employment , but it ran away with [his]147-dick money , and [he]147-dick had drawn in advance the hundred and twenty pounds to which [he]147-dick was entitled yearly . ' Now [I]147-dick shall have to work and starve ! '[147-dick] thought [he]147-dick , and was addressing [himself]147-dick to this new fate when a mysterious telegram arrived from [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow in [England]18-england , which said , ' Come back , [quick]2245-quick ; [you]2245-quick have caught on . Come . '[147-dick]

A large smile overspread [his]147-dick face . ' So soon ! that 's a good hearing , '[147-dick] said [he]147-dick to [himself]147-dick . ' There will be an orgy to - night . [I]147-dick 'll stand or fall by [my]147-dick luck . Faith , it 's time it came ! '[147-dick] [He]147-dick deposited half of [his]147-dick funds in the hands of [[his]147-dick well - known friends]643-his well - known friends [Monsieur]644-monsieur and [Madame Binat]162-madame , and ordered [himself]147-dick a Zanzibar dance of the finest . [Monsieur Binat]163-monsieur binat was shaking with drink , but [Madame]162-madame smiles sympathetically - ' [Monsieur]2246-monsieur needs a chair , of course , and of course [Monsieur]2247-monsieur will sketch ; [Monsieur]2248-monsieur amuses [himself]2248-monsieur strangely . '[162-madame]

[Binat]162-madame raised a blue - white face from a cot in [the inner room]645-the inner room . ' [I]147-dick understand , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick quavered . ' [We]2249-we all know [Monsieur]2250-monsieur . [Monsieur]2251-monsieur is [an artist]2183-an artist , as [I]147-dick have been . '[147-dick] [Dick]147-dick nodded . ' In the end , '[162-madame] said [Binat]162-madame , with gravity , ' [Monsieur]2253-monsieur will descend alive into hell , as [I]147-dick have descended . '[147-dick] And [he]147-dick laughed .

' [You]162-madame must come to the dance , too , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick ; ' [I]147-dick shall want [you]162-madame . '[147-dick]

' For [my]162-madame face ? [I]162-madame knew it would be so . For [my]162-madame face ? [[My]162-madame God]2254-my god ! and for [my]162-madame degradation so tremendous ! [I]162-madame will not . Take [him]2253-monsieur away . [He]2253-monsieur is [a devil]2255-a devil . Or at least do [thou]2256-thou , [Celeste]164-celeste , demand of [him]2253-monsieur more . '[162-madame] [The excellent Binat]162-madame began to kick and scream .

' All things are for sale in [Port]36-port said Said , '[162-madame] said [Madame]162-madame . ' If [[my]162-madame husband]2257-my husband comes it will be so much more . Eh , '[162-madame] how [you]162-madame call - ' alf [a sovereign]2258-a sovereign . '[162-madame]

The money was paid , and the mad dance was held at night in [a walled courtyard at the back of [[Madame Binat]162-madame 's house]647-madame binat 's house]646-a walled courtyard at the back of madame binat 's house . [The lady]648-the lady [herself]648-the lady , in faded mauve silk always about to slide from [her]648-the lady yellow shoulders , played the piano , and to the tin - pot music of a Western waltz [the naked Zanzibari girls]649-the naked zanzibari girls danced furiously by the light of kerosene lamps . [Binat]162-madame sat upon a chair and stared with eyes that saw nothing , till the whirl of the dance and the clang of the rattling piano stole into the drink that took the place of blood in [his]650-his veins , and [his]650-his face glistened . [Dick]147-dick took [him]650-his by the chin brutally and turned that face to the light . [Madame Binat]162-madame looked over [her]162-madame shoulder and smiled with many teeth . [Dick]147-dick leaned against the wall and sketched for an hour , till the kerosene lamps began to smell , and [the girls]651-the girls threw [themselves]651-the girls panting on the hard - beaten ground . Then [he]147-dick shut [his]147-dick book with a snap and moved away , [Binat]162-madame plucking feebly at [his]147-dick elbow . ' Show [me]147-dick , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick whimpered . ' [I]147-dick too was once [an artist]2183-an artist , even [I]147-dick ! '[147-dick] [Dick]147-dick showed [him]650-his the rough sketch . ' Am [I]147-dick that ? '[147-dick] [he]147-dick screamed . ' Will [you]162-madame take that away with [you]162-madame and show all [the world]327-the world that it is [I]147-dick , - [Binat]162-madame ? '[147-dick] [He]147-dick moaned and wept .

' [Monsieur]2261-monsieur has paid for all , '[162-madame] said [Madame]162-madame . ' To the pleasure of seeing [Monsieur]2262-monsieur again . '[162-madame]

[The courtyard]652-the courtyard gate shut , and [Dick]147-dick hurried up [the sandy street]653-the sandy street to [the nearest gambling - hell , where [he]147-dick was well known]654-the nearest gambling - hell , where he was well known . ' If the luck holds , it 's an omen ; if [I]147-dick lose , [I]147-dick must stay [here]2226-here . '[147-dick] [He]147-dick placed [his]147-dick money picturesquely about the board , hardly daring to look at what [he]147-dick did . The luck held .

Three turns of the wheel left [him]147-dick richer by twenty pounds , and [he]147-dick went down to [the shipping]655-the shipping to make friends with [the captain of [a decayed cargo - steamer]657-a decayed cargo - steamer]656-the captain of a decayed cargo - steamer , who landed [him]147-dick in [London]33-london with fewer pounds in [his]147-dick pocket than [he]147-dick cared to think about .

A thin gray fog hung over [the city]605-the city , and [the streets]659-the streets were very cold ; for summer was in [England]18-england .

' It 's [a cheerful wilderness]2264-a cheerful wilderness , and it has n't the knack of altering much , '[147-dick] [Dick]147-dick thought , as [he]147-dick tramped from [the Docks]660-the docks westward . ' Now , what must [I]147-dick do ? '[147-dick]

[The packed houses]661-the packed houses gave no answer . [Dick]147-dick looked down [the long lightless streets]662-the long lightless streets and at the appalling rush of traffic . ' Oh , [you rabbit - hutches]2265-you rabbit - hutches ! '[147-dick] said [he]147-dick , addressing a row of [highly respectable semi - detached residences]663-highly respectable semi - detached residences . ' Do [you]2265-you rabbit - hutches know what [you]2265-you rabbit - hutches 've got to do later on ? '[147-dick] [He]147-dick stepped forward energetically ; [he]147-dick saw that one of [his]147-dick shoes was burst at the side . As [he]147-dick stooped to make investigations , [a man]308-a man jostled [him]147-dick into the gutter . ' All right , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick said .

' That 's another nick in the score . [I]308-a man 'll jostle [you]2265-you rabbit - hutches later on . '[308-a man]

Good clothes and boots are not cheap , and [Dick]147-dick left [[his]147-dick last shop]665-his last shop with the certainty that [he]147-dick would be respectably arrayed for a time , but with only fifty shillings in [his]147-dick pocket . [He]147-dick returned to [[streets]666-streets by [the Docks]660-the docks]667-streets by the docks , and lodged [himself]147-dick in [one room]669-one room , where the sheets on the bed were almost audibly marked in case of theft , and where [nobody]670-nobody seemed to go to bed at all . When [his]147-dick clothes arrived [he]147-dick sought [the Central Southern Syndicate for [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow 's address]671-the central southern syndicate for torpenhow 's address , and got it , with the intimation that there was still some money waiting for [him]147-dick .

' How much ? '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , as one who habitually dealt in millions .

' Between thirty and forty pounds . If it would be any convenience to [you]147-dick , of course [we]2270-we could let [you]147-dick have it at once ; but [we]2270-we usually settle accounts monthly . '[0-i]

' If [I]0-i show that [I]0-i want anything now , [I]0-i 'm[0-i] lost , ' [he]0-i said to [himself]0-i . '[0-i] All [I]0-i need [I]0-i 'll take later on . ' Then , aloud , '[0-i] It 's hardly worth while ; and [I]0-i 'm going to [the country]2271-the country for a month , too . Wait till [I]0-i come back , and [I]0-i 'll see about it . '[0-i]

' But [we]2270-we trust , [Mr. Heldar]165-mr. heldar , that [you]147-dick do not intend to sever [your]147-dick connection with [us]2270-we ? '[0-i]

[Dick]147-dick 's business in life was the study of faces , and [he]147-dick watched [the speaker]672-the speaker keenly . ' [That man]2272-that man means something , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick said . ' [I]147-dick 'll do no business till [I]147-dick 've seen [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow . There 's a big deal coming . '[147-dick] So [he]147-dick departed , making no promises , to [[his]147-dick one little room by [the Docks]660-the docks]673-his one little room by the docks . And that day was the seventh of the month , and that month , [he]147-dick reckoned with awful distinctness , had thirty - one days in it !

It is not easy for [a man of catholic tastes and healthy appetites to exist for twenty - four days on fifty shillings]675-a man of catholic tastes and healthy appetites to exist for twenty - four days on fifty shillings . Nor is it cheering to begin the experiment alone in all the loneliness of [London]33-london . [Dick]147-dick paid seven shillings a week for [his]147-dick lodging , which left [him]147-dick rather less than a shilling a day for food and drink . Naturally , [his]147-dick first purchase was of the materials of [his]147-dick craft ; [he]147-dick had been without them too long . Half a day 's investigations and comparison brought [him]147-dick to the conclusion that sausages and mashed potatoes , twopence a plate , were the best food . Now , sausages once or twice a week for breakfast are not unpleasant . As lunch , even , with mashed potatoes , they become monotonous . At dinner they are impertinent . At the end of three days [Dick]147-dick loathed sausages , and , going , forth , pawned [his]147-dick watch to revel on sheep 's head , which is not as cheap as it looks , owing to the bones and the gravy . Then [he]147-dick returned to sausages and mashed potatoes . Then [he]147-dick confined [himself]147-dick entirely to mashed potatoes for a day , and was unhappy because of pain in [his]147-dick inside . Then [he]147-dick pawned [his]147-dick waistcoat and [his]147-dick tie , and thought regretfully of money thrown away in times past . There are few things more edifying unto [Art]166-art than the actual belly - pinch of hunger , and [Dick]147-dick in [his]147-dick few walks abroad , - [he]147-dick did not care for exercise ; it raised desires that could not be satisfied - found [himself]147-dick dividing mankind into two classes , - [those who looked as if [they]676-those who looked as if they might give him something to eat might give [him]147-dick something to eat]676-those who looked as if they might give him something to eat , and [those who looked otherwise]677-those who looked otherwise . ' [I]147-dick never knew what [I]147-dick had to learn about the human face before , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick thought ; and , as a reward for [his]147-dick humility , [Providence]151-providence caused [a cab - driver]678-a cab - driver at [a sausage - shop]679-a sausage - shop where [Dick]147-dick fed that night to leave half eaten a great chunk of bread . [Dick]147-dick took it , - would have fought all [the world]327-the world for its possession , - and it cheered [him]147-dick .

The month dragged through at last , and , nearly prancing with impatience , [he]147-dick went to draw [his]147-dick money . Then [he]147-dick hastened to [[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow 's address]681-torpenhow 's address and smelt the smell of cooking meats all along [the corridors of [the chambers]683-the chambers]682-the corridors of the chambers . [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow was on [the top floor]684-the top floor , and [Dick]147-dick burst into [[his]147-dick room]685-his room , to be received with a hug which nearly cracked [his]147-dick ribs , as [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow dragged [him]147-dick tot [he]147-dick light and spoke of twenty different things in the same breath .

' But [you]147-dick 're[147-dick] looking tucked up , ' [he]147-dick concluded .[147-dick]

' [I]147-dick shall be having breakfast in a minute . What do [you]147-dick say to sausages ? '[147-dick]

' No , anything but sausages ! [Torp]167-torp , [I]147-dick 've been starving on that accursed horse - flesh for thirty days and thirty nights . '[147-dick]

' Now , what lunacy has been [your]147-dick latest ? '[147-dick]

[Dick]147-dick spoke of the last few weeks with unbridled speech . Then [he]147-dick opened [his]147-dick coat ; there was no waistcoat below . ' [I]147-dick ran it fine , awfully fine , but [I]147-dick 've just scraped through . '[147-dick]

' [You]147-dick have n't much sense , but [you]147-dick 've got a backbone , anyhow . Eat , and talk afterwards . '[147-dick] [Dick]147-dick fell upon eggs and bacon and gorged till [he]147-dick could gorge no more . ' Ouf ! '[147-dick] said [he]147-dick . ' That 's heavenly ! Well ? '[147-dick]

'[147-dick]

[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow watched [Dick]147-dick 's face and whistled .

[Dick]147-dick walked up and down , thinking .
