The injustice of the proceedings did not much move [him]147-dick ; [he]147-dick had seen the strong hand prevail too often in other places to be squeamish over the moral aspects of right and wrong .

But [he]147-dick ardently desired the blood of [the gentleman in the frockcoat]720-the gentleman in the frockcoat , and when [he]147-dick spoke again it was with a strained sweetness that [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow knew well for the beginning of strife .

[The man]493-the man stared blankly at [Dick]147-dick , and then at [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , who was leaning against the wall . ' [I]147-dick do n't know quite what to do with [you]493-the man , '[147-dick] began [Dick]147-dick , meditatively . [The head of the syndicate]732-the head of the syndicate began to breathe heavily . [Dick]147-dick walked round [him]493-the man , pawing [him]493-the man , as a cat paws a soft hearth - rug . ' [You]493-the man were going to steal [my]147-dick things , - mine , [mine]147-dick , [mine]147-dick ! - [you]493-the man , who do n't know when [you]493-the man may die .[147-dick]

Write a note to [[your]493-the man office]733-your office , - [you]493-the man say [you]493-the man 're the head of it , - and order [them]733-your office to give [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow [my]147-dick sketches , - every one of them . Wait a minute : [your]493-the man hand 's shaking . Now ! '[147-dick] [He]147-dick thrust a pocket - book before [him]147-dick . The note was written . [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow took it and departed without a word , while [Dick]147-dick walked round and round [the spellbound captive]734-the spellbound captive , giving [him]734-the spellbound captive such advice as [he]147-dick conceived best for the welfare of [his]734-the spellbound captive soul . When [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow returned with a gigantic portfolio , [he]156-torpenhow heard [Dick]147-dick say , almost soothingly , ' Now , [I]147-dick hope this will be a lesson to [you]493-the man ; and if [you]493-the man worry [me]147-dick when [I]147-dick have settled down to work with any nonsense about actions for assault , believe [me]147-dick , [I]147-dick 'll catch [you]493-the man and manhandle [you]493-the man , and [you]493-the man 'll die . [You]493-the man have n't very long to live , anyhow . Go ! [Imshi]170-imshi , [Vootsak]171-vootsak , - get out ! '[147-dick] [The man]493-the man departed , staggering and dazed . [Dick]147-dick drew a long breath : ' Phew ! what [a lawless lot these people]2304-a lawless lot these people are ! The first thing [a poor orphan]2305-a poor orphan meets is gang robbery , organised burglary ! Think of the hideous blackness of [that man]2272-that man 's mind ! Are [my]147-dick sketches all right , [Torp]167-torp ? '[147-dick]

' Yes ; one hundred and forty - seven of them . Well , [I]156-torpenhow must say , [Dick]147-dick , [you]147-dick 've begun well . '[156-torpenhow]

' [He]2272-that man was interfering with [me]147-dick . It only meant a few pounds to [him]2272-that man , but it was everything to [me]147-dick . [I]147-dick do n't think [he]2272-that man 'll bring an action . [I]147-dick gave [him]2272-that man some medical advice gratis about the state of [his]2272-that man body . It was cheap at the little flurry it cost [him]2272-that man . Now , let 's look at [my]147-dick things . '[147-dick]

Two minutes later [Dick]147-dick had thrown [himself]147-dick down on the floor and was deep in the portfolio , chuckling lovingly as [he]147-dick turned the drawings over and thought of the price at which they had been bought .

The afternoon was well advanced when [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow came to the door and saw [Dick]147-dick dancing a wild saraband under the skylight .

' [I]156-torpenhow builded better than [I]156-torpenhow knew , [Torp]167-torp , '[156-torpenhow] [he]156-torpenhow said , without stopping the dance .

' [They]736-they 're[736-they] good ! [They]736-they 're damned good ! [They]736-they 'll go like flame ! [I]156-torpenhow shall have an exhibition of them on [my]156-torpenhow own brazen hook . And [that man]2272-that man would have cheated [me]156-torpenhow out of it ! Do [you]167-torp know that [I]156-torpenhow 'm[156-torpenhow] sorry now that [I]0-i did n't actually hit [him]737-him ? '[0-i]

' Go out , '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , - ' go out and pray to be delivered from the sin of arrogance , which [you]167-torp never will be . Bring [your]167-torp things up from whatever place [you]167-torp 're[156-torpenhow] staying in , and [we]738-we 'll try to make [this barn]739-this barn a little more shipshape . '[156-torpenhow]

' And then - oh , then , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , still capering , ' [we]738-we will spoil [the Egyptians]172-the egyptians ! '[147-dick]

CHAPTER IV

[The wolf - cub]740-the wolf - cub at even lay hid in the corn , When the smoke of the cooking hung gray : [He]740-the wolf - cub knew where [the doe]741-the doe made a couch for [her]741-the doe fawn , And [he]740-the wolf - cub looked to [his]740-the wolf - cub strength for [his]740-the wolf - cub prey .

But the moon swept the smoke - wreaths away .

And [he]740-the wolf - cub turned from [his]740-the wolf - cub meal in [[the villager]742-the villager 's close]743-the villager 's close , And [he]740-the wolf - cub bayed to the moon as [she]741-the doe rose .

- In [Seonee]173-seonee . ' WELL , and how does success taste ? '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , some three months later . [He]156-torpenhow had just returned to [chambers]744-chambers after a holiday in [the country]2271-the country .

' Good , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , as [he]147-dick sat licking [his]147-dick lips before the easel in [the studio]712-the studio .

' [I]156-torpenhow want more , - heaps more . The lean years have passed , and [I]156-torpenhow approve of these fat ones . '[156-torpenhow]

' Be careful , [old man]2243-old man . That way lies bad work . '[156-torpenhow]

[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow was sprawling in a long chair with a small fox - terrier asleep on [his]156-torpenhow chest , while [Dick]147-dick was preparing a canvas . A dais , a background , and a lay - figure were the only fixed objects in [the place]700-the place . They rose from a wreck of oddments that began with felt - covered water - bottles , belts , and regimental badges , and ended with a small bale of second - hand uniforms and a stand of mixed arms . The mark of muddy feet on the dais showed that [a military model]748-a military model had just gone away . The watery autumn sunlight was falling , and shadows sat in the corners of [the studio]712-the studio .

' Yes , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , deliberately , ' [I]147-dick like the power ; [I]147-dick like the fun ; [I]147-dick like the fuss ; and above all [I]147-dick like the money . [I]147-dick almost like [the people who make the fuss and pay the money]2309-the people who make the fuss and pay the money . Almost . But [they]750-a queer gang 're[147-dick] [a queer gang]750-a queer gang , - [an amazingly queer gang]751-an amazingly queer gang ! '[147-dick]

' [They]750-a queer gang have been good enough to [you]2243-old man , at any rate . That tin - pot exhibition of [your]2243-old man sketches must have paid . Did [you]2243-old man see that the papers called it the " Wild Work Show " ? '[147-dick]

' Never mind . [I]147-dick sold every shred of canvas [I]147-dick wanted to ; and , on [my]147-dick word , [I]147-dick believe it was because [they]750-a queer gang believed [I]147-dick was [a self - taught flagstone artist]2310-a self - taught flagstone artist .[147-dick]

[I]0-i should have got better prices if [I]0-i worked [my]0-i things on wool or scratched them on camel - bone instead of using mere black and white and colour . Verily , [they]750-a queer gang are [a queer gang]750-a queer gang , [these people]753-these people . Limited is n't the word to describe 'em . [I]147-dick met [a fellow the other day who told [me]147-dick that it was impossible that shadows on white sand]2311-a fellow the other day who told me that it was impossible that shadows on white sand should be blue , - ultramarine , - as they are . [I]147-dick found out , later , that [the man]493-the man had been as far as [Brighton]43-brighton beach ; but [he]493-the man knew all about Art , confound [him]493-the man . [He]493-the man gave [me]147-dick a lecture on it , and recommended [me]147-dick to go to [school]340-school to learn technique . [I]147-dick wonder what [old Kami]174-kami would have said to that . '[147-dick]

' When were [you]147-dick under [Kami]174-kami , [man of extraordinary beginnings]2314-man of extraordinary beginnings ? '[750-a queer gang]

' [I]147-dick studied with [him]174-kami for two years in [Paris]44-paris . [He]174-kami taught by personal magnetism . All [he]174-kami ever said was , " Continuez , [mes]147-dick enfants , " and [you]147-dick had to make the best [you]147-dick could of that . [He]174-kami had a divine touch , and [he]174-kami knew something about colour . [Kami]174-kami used to dream colour ; [I]147-dick swear [he]174-kami could never have seen the genuine article ; but [he]174-kami evolved it ; and it was good . '[147-dick]

' Recollect some of those views in [the Soudan]45-the soudan ? '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , with a provoking drawl .

[Dick]147-dick squirmed in [his]147-dick place . ' Do n't ! It makes [me]147-dick want to get out there again . What colour that was ! Opal and umber and amber and claret and brick - red and sulphur - cockatoo - crest - sulphur - against brown , with a nigger - black rock sticking up in the middle of it all , and a decorative frieze of camels festooning in front of a pure pale turquoise sky . '[147-dick] [He]147-dick began to walk up and down . ' And yet , [you]147-dick know , if [you]147-dick try to give [these people]753-these people the thing as [God]161-god gave [it]2316-it , keyed down to [their]753-these people comprehension and according to the powers [He]161-god has given [you]147-dick - - '[147-dick]

' [Modest man]2317-modest man ! Go on . '[147-dick]

' [Half a dozen epicene young pagans who have n't even been to [Algiers]32-algiers]2318-half a dozen epicene young pagans who have n't even been to algiers will tell [you]175-dickie , first , that [your]175-dickie notion is borrowed , and , secondly , that it is n't Art .[147-dick]

" This comes of [my]0-i leaving [town]754-town for a month . [Dickie]175-dickie , [you]175-dickie 've been promenading among [the toy - shops]755-the toy - shops and hearing [people]2276-people talk . '[2276-people]

' [I]147-dick could n't help it , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , penitently . ' [You]175-dickie were n't [here]2226-here , and it was lonely these long evenings . [A man]308-a man ca n't work for ever . '[147-dick]

' [A man]308-a man might have gone to [a pub]2322-a pub , and got decently drunk . '[147-dick]

' [I]147-dick wish [I]147-dick had ; but [I]147-dick forgathered with [some men of sorts]2323-some men of sorts . [They]2323-some men of sorts said [they]2323-some men of sorts were [artists]2185-artists , and [I]147-dick knew some of [them]2323-some men of sorts could draw , - but [they]2323-some men of sorts would n't draw . [They]2323-some men of sorts gave [me]147-dick tea , - tea at five in the afternoon ! - and talked about Art and the state of [their]2323-some men of sorts souls . As if [their]2323-some men of sorts souls mattered . [I]147-dick 've heard more about [Art]166-art and seen less of [her]2325-her in the last six months than in the whole of [my]147-dick life . Do [you]2326-you remember [Cassavetti]176-cassavetti , who worked for [some continental syndicate]2327-some continental syndicate , out with the desert column ? [He]759-he was a regular Christmas - tree of contraptions when [he]759-he took [the field]2328-the field in full fig , with [his]759-he water - bottle , lanyard , revolver , writing - case , [housewife]2329-housewife , gig - lamps , and [the Lord]2330-the lord knows what all . [He]759-he used to fiddle about with 'em[147-dick] and show [us]757-us how [they]758-they worked ; but [he]759-he never seemed to do much except fudge [his]759-he reports from [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai . See ? '[759-he]

' [Dear old Nilghai]177-the nilghai ! [He]759-he 's in [town]754-town , fatter than ever . [He]759-he ought to be up [here]2226-here this evening . [I]147-dick see the comparison perfectly . [You]147-dick should have kept clear of all that man - millinery . Serves [you]147-dick right ; and [I]147-dick hope it will unsettle [your]147-dick mind . '[147-dick]

' It wo n't . It has taught [me]759-he what Art - holy sacred Art - means . '[759-he]

' [You]147-dick 've learnt something while [I]147-dick 've been away . What is Art ? '[147-dick]

' Give 'em[759-he] what [they]758-they know , and when [you]760-you 've done it once do it again . '[760-you]

[Dick]147-dick dragged forward a canvas laid face to the wall . ' Here 's a sample of real Art . It 's going to be a facsimile reproduction for a weekly . [I]147-dick called it " [His]759-he Last Shot . " It 's worked up from the little water - colour [I]147-dick made outside [El Maghrib]47-el - maghrib . Well , [I]147-dick lured [[my]147-dick model]2333-my model , [a beautiful rifleman]2334-a beautiful rifleman , up here with drink ; [I]147-dick drored [him]2333-my model , and [I]147-dick redrored [him]2333-my model , and [I]147-dick redrored [him]2333-my model , and [I]147-dick made [him]2333-my model [a flushed , dishevelled , bedevilled scallawag , with [his]2333-my model helmet at the back of [his]2333-my model head]2335-a flushed , dishevelled , bedevilled scallawag , with his helmet at the back of his head , and the living fear of death in [his]2333-my model eye , and the blood oozing out of a cut over [his]2333-my model ankle - bone . [He]2333-my model was n't pretty , but [he]2333-my model was all [soldier]2224-soldier and very much [man]2294-man . '[147-dick]

' Once more , [modest child]2338-modest child ! '[147-dick]

[Dick]147-dick laughed . ' Well , it 's only to [you]2338-modest child [I]147-dick 'm[147-dick] talking . [I]0-i did [him]761-his just as well as [I]0-i knew how , making allowance for the slickness of oils . Then [the art - manager of that abandoned paper]762-the art - manager of that abandoned paper said that [[his]762-the art - manager of that abandoned paper subscribers]763-his subscribers would n't like it . [They]763-his subscribers wanted something more restful , with a little more colour . Behold the result ! [I]0-i put [him]761-his into a lovely red coat without a speck on it . That is [Art]166-art . [I]0-i polished [his]761-his boots , - observe the high light on the toe . That is [Art]166-art . [I]0-i cleaned [his]761-his rifle , - rifles are always clean on service , - because that is Art .

[I]0-i pipeclayed [his]761-his helmet , - pipeclay is always used on active service , and is indispensable to [Art]166-art . [I]0-i shaved [his]761-his chin , [I]0-i washed [his]761-his hands , and gave [him]761-his an air of fatted peace . Result , [military tailor]768-military tailor 's pattern - plate . Price , thank [Heaven]178-heaven , twice as much as for the first sketch , which was moderately decent . '[178-heaven]

' And do [you]156-torpenhow suppose [you]156-torpenhow 're[178-heaven] going to give that thing out as [your]0-i work ? '[178-heaven]

' Why not ? [I]178-heaven did it . Alone [I]178-heaven did it , in the interests of sacred , home - bred Art and [Dickenson]179-dickenson 's Weekly . '[178-heaven]

[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow smoked in silence for a while . Then came the verdict , delivered from rolling clouds : ' If [you]156-torpenhow were only a mass of blathering vanity , [Dick]147-dick , [I]178-heaven would n't mind , - [I]178-heaven 'd let [you]156-torpenhow go to the deuce on [your]156-torpenhow own mahl - stick ; but when [I]178-heaven consider what [you]156-torpenhow are to [me]178-heaven , and when [I]178-heaven find that to vanity [you]156-torpenhow add the twopenny - halfpenny pique of [a twelve - year - old girl]2339-a twelve - year - old girl , then [I]178-heaven bestir [myself]178-heaven in [your]156-torpenhow behalf . Thus ! '[178-heaven]

The canvas ripped as [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow 's booted foot shot through it , and the terrier jumped down , thinking rats were about .

' If [you]156-torpenhow have any bad language to use , use it . [You]156-torpenhow have not . [I]770-an idiot continue .[770-an idiot]

[You]769-you are [an idiot]770-an idiot , because [no man born of woman]771-no man born of woman is strong enough to take liberties with [[his]771-no man born of woman public]772-his public , even though [they]772-his public be - which [they]772-his public ai n't - all [you]769-you say [they]772-his public are . '[769-you]

'[147-dick] [Dick]147-dick pointed to the yellow fog . ' If [they]772-his public want furniture - polish , let [them]772-his public have furniture - polish , so long as [they]772-his public pay for it .[147-dick]

[They]773-they are only [men]430-men and [women]775-women . [You]769-you talk as if [they]773-they were [gods]776-gods . '[769-you]

' That sounds very fine , but it has nothing to do with the case . [They]773-they are [the people [you]769-you have to do work for]2341-the people you have to do work for , whether [you]769-you like it or not . Moreover , - Come back , [Binkie]180-binkie : that red daub is n't going anywhere , - unless [you]769-you take precious good care , [you]769-you will fall under the damnation of the check - book , and that 's worse than death . [You]769-you will get drunk - [you]769-you - re half drunk already - on easily acquired money . ' Do n't know , said [Dick]147-dick . '[0-i] [I]0-i 've been trying to make [myself]0-i angry , but [I]0-i ca n't , [you]175-dickie 're so abominably reasonable . There will be a row on [Dickenson]179-dickenson 's Weekly , [I]175-dickie fancy . '[175-dickie]

' Why [the Dickenson]179-dickenson do [you]147-dick want to work on a weekly paper ? It 's slow bleeding of power . '[175-dickie]

' It brings in the very desirable dollars , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , [his]147-dick hands in [his]147-dick pockets .

[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow watched [him]147-dick with large contempt . ' Why , [I]156-torpenhow thought it was [a man]308-a man ! '[156-torpenhow] said [he]156-torpenhow . ' It 's [a child]2344-a child . '[156-torpenhow]

' No , it is n't , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , wheeling quickly . ' [You]147-dick 've no notion what the certainty of cash means to [a man who has always wanted it badly]2345-a man who has always wanted it badly .[147-dick]

Nothing will pay [me]0-i for some of [my]0-i life 's joys ; on [that Chinese pig - boat]777-that chinese pig - boat , for instance , when [we]778-we ate bread and jam for every meal , because [Ho - Wang]181-ho - wang would n't allow [us]778-we anything better , and it all tasted of pig , - Chinese pig . And now [I]0-i 've got it [I]0-i am going to make the most of it while it lasts . Let [them]779-them pay - [they]779-them 've no knowledge . '[779-them]

' What does [[Your]147-dick Majesty]2346-your majesty please to want ? [You]780-a gross feeder ca n't smoke more than [you]780-a gross feeder do ; [you]780-a gross feeder wo n't drink ; [you]780-a gross feeder 're[780-a gross feeder] [a gross feeder]780-a gross feeder ; and [you]780-a gross feeder dress in the dark , by the look of [you]780-a gross feeder . What earthly need have [you]780-a gross feeder for money ? '[780-a gross feeder]

' It 's there , bless its golden heart , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick . ' It 's there all the time .[147-dick]

[Providence]151-providence has sent [me]0-i nuts while [I]0-i have teeth to crack 'em with . [I]151-providence have n't yet found the nut [I]151-providence wish to crack , but [I]151-providence 'm[151-providence] keeping [my]0-i teeth filed .

Perhaps some day [you]780-a gross feeder and [I]0-i will go for a walk round [the wide earth]782-the wide earth . '[0-i]

' With no work to do , [nobody]670-nobody to worry [us]2348-our , and [nobody]670-nobody to compete with ? [You]780-a gross feeder would be unfit to speak to in a week . ' Do n't see it . ' Surely . '[147-dick] And [Dick]147-dick departed , to take counsel with [himself]147-dick in the rapidly gathering [London]33-london fog .

Half an hour after [he]147-dick had left , [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai laboured up [the staircase]783-the staircase . [He]177-the nilghai was the chiefest , as [he]177-the nilghai was the youngest , of [the war correspondents]784-the war correspondents , and [his]177-the nilghai experiences dated from the birth of the needle - gun . Saving only [[his]177-the nilghai ally]785-his ally , [Keneu the Great War Eagle]183-the keneu , there was [no man higher in the craft]786-no man higher in the craft than [he]177-the nilghai , and [he]177-the nilghai always opened [his]177-the nilghai conversation with the news that there would be trouble in [the Balkans]48-the balkans in the spring . [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow laughed as [he]156-torpenhow entered .

' Never mind the trouble in [the Balkans]48-the balkans . [Those little states]2358-those little states are always screeching . [You]156-torpenhow 've heard about [Dick]147-dick 's luck ? '[156-torpenhow]

' Yes ; [he]147-dick has been called up to notoriety , has n't [he]147-dick ? [I]156-torpenhow hope [you]156-torpenhow keep [him]147-dick properly humble . [He]147-dick wants suppressing from time to time . '[156-torpenhow]

' [He]147-dick does . [He]147-dick 's beginning to take liberties with what [he]147-dick thinks is [his]147-dick reputation . '[156-torpenhow]

' Already ! By [Jove]184-jove , [he]147-dick has cheek ! [I]156-torpenhow do n't know about [his]147-dick reputation , but [he]147-dick 'll come a cropper if [he]147-dick tries that sort of thing . '[156-torpenhow]

' So [I]156-torpenhow told [him]147-dick . [I]156-torpenhow do n't think [he]147-dick believes it . '[156-torpenhow]

' [They]2359-they never do when [they]2359-they first start off . What 's that wreck on the ground there ? '[156-torpenhow]

' Specimen of [his]147-dick latest impertinence . '[156-torpenhow] [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow thrust the torn edges of the canvas together and showed the well - groomed picture to [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai , who looked at it for a moment and whistled .

' It 's a chromo , '[156-torpenhow] said [he]156-torpenhow , - ' a chromo - litholeomargarine fake ! What possessed [him]147-dick to do it ? And yet how thoroughly [he]147-dick has caught the note that catches [a public who think with [their]2360-a public who think with their boots and read with their elbows boots and read with [their]2360-a public who think with their boots and read with their elbows elbows]2360-a public who think with their boots and read with their elbows ! The cold - blooded insolence of the work almost saves it ; but [he]147-dick must n't go on with this . Has n't [he]147-dick been praised and cockered up too much ? [You]2361-you know [these people here]2362-these people here have no sense of proportion . [They]2362-these people here 'll call [him]147-dick [a second Detaille]2363-a second detaille and [a third - hand Meissonier]2364-a third - hand meissonier while [his]147-dick fashion lasts . It 's windy diet for [a colt]2365-a colt . '[156-torpenhow]

' [I]156-torpenhow do n't think it affects [Dick]147-dick much . [You]2361-you might as well call [a young wolf]2366-a young wolf a lion and expect [him]147-dick to take the compliment in exchange for a shin - bone .[156-torpenhow]

[Dick]147-dick 's soul is in the bank . [He]147-dick 's working for cash . '[147-dick]

' Now [he]147-dick has thrown up war work , [I]156-torpenhow suppose [he]147-dick does n't see that the obligations of the service are just the same , only [the proprietors]2367-the proprietors are changed . '[156-torpenhow]

' How should [he]147-dick know ? [He]147-dick thinks [he]147-dick is [[his]147-dick own master]2368-his own master . '[147-dick]

' Does [he]147-dick ? [I]156-torpenhow could undeceive [him]147-dick for [his]147-dick good , if there 's any virtue in print . [He]147-dick wants the whiplash . '[156-torpenhow]

' Lay it on with science , then . [I]147-dick 'd flay [him]147-dick [myself]147-dick , but [I]147-dick like [him]147-dick too much . '[147-dick]

' [I]156-torpenhow 've no scruples . [He]147-dick had the audacity to try to cut [me]156-torpenhow out with [a woman]730-a woman at [Cairo]16-cairo once . [I]156-torpenhow forgot that , but [I]156-torpenhow remember now . '[156-torpenhow]

' Did [he]147-dick cut [you]156-torpenhow out ? '[147-dick]

' [You]156-torpenhow 'll see when [I]156-torpenhow have dealt with [him]147-dick . But , after all , what 's the good ? Leave [him]147-dick alone and [he]147-dick 'll come [home]2172-home , if [he]147-dick has any stuff in [him]147-dick , dragging or wagging [his]147-dick tail behind [him]147-dick . There 's more in a week of life than in a lively weekly . None the less [I]156-torpenhow 'll slate [him]147-dick . [I]156-torpenhow 'll slate [him]147-dick ponderously in the Cataclysm . '[156-torpenhow]

' Good luck to [you]156-torpenhow ; but [I]147-dick fancy nothing short of a crowbar would make [Dick]147-dick wince . [His]147-dick soul seems to have been fired before [we]2371-we came across [him]147-dick .[147-dick]

[He]787-he 's intensely suspicious and utterly lawless . '[787-he]

' Matter of temper , '[177-the nilghai] said [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai . ' It 's the same with horses . [Some]2372-some [you]156-torpenhow wallop and [they]2372-some work , some [you]156-torpenhow wallop and [they]2372-some jib , and some [you]156-torpenhow wallop and [they]2372-some go out for a walk with [their]2372-some hands in [their]2372-some pockets . '[177-the nilghai]

' That 's exactly what [Dick]147-dick has done , '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow . ' Wait till [he]147-dick comes back . [I]156-torpenhow 'll show [you]156-torpenhow some of [his]147-dick last and worst work in [[his]147-dick studio]2374-his studio . '[156-torpenhow]

[Dick]147-dick had instinctively sought running water for a comfort to [his]147-dick mood of mind . [He]147-dick was leaning over the Embankment wall , watching the rush of [the Thames]41-the thames through the arches of [Westminster Bridge]49-westminster bridge . [He]147-dick began by thinking of [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow 's advice , but , as of custom , lost [himself]147-dick in the study of the faces flocking past . [Some]2372-some had death written on [their]2372-some features , and [Dick]147-dick marvelled that [they]2372-some could laugh . [Others , clumsy and coarse - built for the most part]789-others , clumsy and coarse - built for the most part , were alight with love ; [others]790-others were merely drawn and lined with work ; but there was something , [Dick]147-dick knew , to be made out of [them]791-them all . [The poor]792-the poor at least should suffer that [he]147-dick might learn , and [the rich]793-the rich should pay for the output of [his]147-dick learning . Thus [his]147-dick credit in [the world]327-the world and [his]147-dick cash balance at [the bank]795-the bank would be increased . So much the better for [him]147-dick . [He]147-dick had suffered . Now [he]147-dick would take toll of the ills of [others]790-others .

The fog was driven apart for a moment , and the sun shone , a blood - red wafer , on [the water]434-the water . [Dick]147-dick watched the spot till [he]147-dick heard the voice of the tide between [the piers]798-the piers die down like the wash of [the sea]2168-the sea at low tide . [A girl hard pressed by [[her]800-a girl hard pressed by her lover lover]801-her lover]800-a girl hard pressed by her lover shouted shamelessly , ' Ah , get away , [you]147-dick beast ! '[800-a girl hard pressed by her lover] and a shift of the same wind that had opened the fog drove across [Dick]147-dick 's face the black smoke of a river - steamer at [her]800-a girl hard pressed by her lover berth below the wall . [He]147-dick was blinded for the moment , then spun round and found [himself]147-dick face to face with - [Maisie]146-maisie .

There was no mistaking . The years had turned [the child]802-the child to [a woman]730-a woman , but [they]804-they had not altered the dark - gray eyes , the thin scarlet lips , or the firmly modelled mouth and chin ; and , that all should be as it was of old , [she]146-maisie wore a closely fitting gray dress .

Since [the human soul]805-the human soul is finite and not in the least under [its]805-the human soul own command , [Dick]147-dick , advancing , said ' [Halloo]185-halloo ! '[147-dick] after the manner of [schoolboys]806-schoolboys , and [Maisie]146-maisie answered , ' Oh , [Dick]147-dick , is that [you]147-dick ? '[146-maisie] Then , against [his]147-dick will , and before the brain newly released from considerations of the cash balance had time to dictate to the nerves , every pulse of [Dick]147-dick 's body throbbed furiously and [his]147-dick palate dried in [his]147-dick mouth . The fog shut down again , and [Maisie]146-maisie 's face was pearl - white through it . No word was spoken , but [Dick]147-dick fell into step at [her]146-maisie side , and [the two]490-the two paced [the Embankment]808-the embankment together , keeping the step as perfectly as in [their]490-the two afternoon excursions to [the mud - flats]366-the mud - flats . Then [Dick]147-dick , a little hoarsely - ' What has happened to [Amomma]149-amomma ? '[147-dick]

' [He]149-amomma died , [Dick]147-dick . Not cartridges ; over - eating . [He]149-amomma was always greedy . Is n't it funny ? '[147-dick]

' Yes . No . Do [you]147-dick mean [Amomma]149-amomma ? '[147-dick]

' Well - [I]147-dick - am - damned ! '[147-dick] exclaimed [Dick]147-dick , and returned to [the chambers]683-the chambers .

[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow and [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai found [him]147-dick sitting on the steps to [the studio]712-the studio door , repeating the phrase with an awful gravity .

' Never mind that . [I]147-dick am commissioned to smite [you]147-dick in print . [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow refuses from false delicacy . [I]147-dick 've been overhauling the pot - boilers in [[your]147-dick studio]2385-your studio . They are simply disgraceful . '[147-dick]

' Oho ! that 's it , is it ? If [you]147-dick think [you]147-dick can slate [me]177-the nilghai , [you]147-dick 're[177-the nilghai] wrong . '[147-dick]

' H'm ! h'm ! h'm ! The first part only deals with [your]147-dick pictures . Go on . '[147-dick]

' - - " public , there remains but one end , - the oblivion that is preceded by toleration and cenotaphed with contempt . From that fate [Mr. Heldar]165-mr. heldar has yet to prove [himself]165-mr. heldar out of danger . '[147-dick]

' Wow - wow - wow - wow - wow ! '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , profanely . ' It 's a clumsy ending and vile journalese , but it 's quite true . '[147-dick]

[The Nilghai]177-the nilghai winced . [He]177-the nilghai had not thought of this .

' As it is , [I]177-the nilghai shall take this stuff and tear it small - so ! '[177-the nilghai] The manuscript fluttered in slips down the dark well of the staircase . ' Go [home]2172-home , [Nilghai]177-the nilghai , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick ; ' go [home]2172-home to [[your]177-the nilghai lonely little bed]2394-your lonely little bed , and leave [me]147-dick in peace . [I]147-dick am about to turn in till to - morrow . '[147-dick]

' Why , it is n't seven yet ! '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , with amazement .

The door shut and was locked .

' What can [you]147-dick do with [a man like that]2395-a man like that ? '[177-the nilghai] said [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai .

' All right . Come out and have supper . [You]167-torp 're[147-dick] smoking on an empty stomach . '[147-dick]

There was no answer .

CHAPTER V

' [I]822-you have [a thousand men]2398-a thousand men , '[822-you] said [he]822-you , ' To wait upon [my]822-you will , And towers nine upon [the Tyne]53-the tyne , And three upon the Till . '[822-you]

[Sir Hoggie]188-sir hoggie and the Fairies NEXT morning [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow found [Dick]147-dick sunk in deepest repose of tobacco .

' Well , [madman]2400-madman , how [d'you]2400-madman feel ? '[188-sir hoggie]

' [I]188-sir hoggie do n't know . [I]188-sir hoggie 'm[188-sir hoggie] trying to find out . '[188-sir hoggie]

' [You]188-sir hoggie had much better do some work . '[188-sir hoggie]

' Maybe ; but [I]188-sir hoggie 'm[188-sir hoggie] in no hurry . [I]0-i 've made a discovery . [Torp]167-torp , there 's too much Ego in [my]0-i Cosmos . '[167-torp]

' Not really ! Is this revelation due to [my]188-sir hoggie lectures , or [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai 's ? '[188-sir hoggie]

' It came to [me]167-torp suddenly , all on [my]167-torp own account . Much too much Ego ; and now [I]167-torp 'm[167-torp] going to work . '[167-torp]

[He]167-torp turned over a few half - finished sketches , drummed on a new canvas , cleaned three brushes , set Binkie to bite the toes of [the lay figure]824-the lay figure , rattled through [his]167-torp collection of arms and accoutrements , and then went out abruptly , declaring that [he]167-torp had done enough for the day .

' This is positively indecent , '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , ' and the first time that [Dick]147-dick has ever broken up a light morning . Perhaps [he]167-torp has found out that [he]167-torp has a soul , or an artistic temperament , or something equally valuable .[156-torpenhow]

That comes of leaving [him]167-torp alone for a month . Perhaps [he]167-torp has been going out of evenings . [I]0-i must look to this . ' [He]167-torp rang for [the bald - headed old housekeeper , whom nothing could astonish or annoy]2401-the bald - headed old housekeeper , whom nothing could astonish or annoy .[0-i]

' [Beeton]189-mr. beeton , did [Mr. Heldar]165-mr. heldar dine out at all while [I]156-torpenhow was out of [town]754-town ? '[156-torpenhow]

' Never laid '[0-i] is dress - clothes out once , [sir]2295-sir , all the time . Mostly ' [e]826-e dined in ; but '[826-e] [e]826-e brought [some most remarkable young gentlemen]827-some most remarkable young gentlemen up ' ere after theatres once or twice . Remarkable fancy [they]827-some most remarkable young gentlemen was . [[You]829-you gentlemen on [the top floor]684-the top floor]2403-you gentlemen on the top floor does very much as [you]829-you likes , but it do seem to [me]156-torpenhow , [sir]2295-sir , droppin '[156-torpenhow] a walkin'-stick down [five flights o ' stairs]2406-five flights o ' stairs an '[0-i] then goin' down four abreast to pick it up again at half - past two in the mornin ' , singin , '[0-i] " Bring back the whiskey , [Willie]190-willie darlin , ' " - not once or twice , but scores o '[190-willie] times , - is n't charity to [the other tenants]828-the other tenants . What [I]0-i say is , " Do as [you]829-you would be done by . " That 's [my]0-i motto . '[0-i]

' Of course ! of course ! [I]0-i 'm[0-i] afraid [the top floor]684-the top floor is n't the quietest in [the house]330-the house . '[0-i]

' [I]832-i make no complaints , [sir]2295-sir . [I]832-i have spoke to [Mr. Heldar friendly]165-mr. heldar , an '[832-i] [he]832-i laughed , an ' did [me]832-i a picture of the missis that is as good as a coloured print . It '[832-i] asn't the high shine of a photograph , but what [I]0-i say is , " Never look a gift - horse in the mouth . " [Mr. Heldar]165-mr. heldar 's dress - clothes ' aven't been on [him]832-i for weeks . '[165-mr. heldar]

' Then it 's all right , '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow to [himself]156-torpenhow . ' Orgies are healthy , and [Dick]147-dick has a head of [his]147-dick own , but when it comes to [women]775-women making eyes [I]156-torpenhow 'm[156-torpenhow] not so certain , - [Binkie]180-binkie , never [you]180-binkie be [a man]308-a man , [little dorglums]834-little dorglums . [They]835-they 're [contrary brutes]2409-contrary brutes , and [they]835-they do things without any reason . '[835-they]

[Dick]147-dick had turned northward across [the Park]812-the park , but [he]147-dick was walking in the spirit on [the mud - flats]366-the mud - flats with [Maisie]146-maisie . [He]147-dick laughed aloud as [he]147-dick remembered the day when [he]147-dick had decked [Amomma]149-amomma 's horns with the ham - frills , and [Maisie]146-maisie , white with rage , had cuffed [him]147-dick . How long those four years seemed in review , and how closely [Maisie]146-maisie was connected with every hour of [them]838-them ! Storm across [the sea]2168-the sea , and [Maisie]146-maisie in a gray dress on [the beach]347-the beach , sweeping [her]146-maisie drenched hair out of [her]146-maisie eyes and laughing at the homeward race of the fishing - smacks ; hot sunshine on [the mud - flats]366-the mud - flats , and [Maisie]146-maisie sniffing scornfully , with [her]146-maisie chin in the air ; [Maisie]146-maisie flying before the wind that threshed [the foreshore]381-the foreshore and drove the sand like small shot about [her]146-maisie ears ; [Maisie]146-maisie , very composed and independent , telling lies to [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett while [Dick]147-dick supported [her]146-maisie with coarser perjuries ; [Maisie]146-maisie picking [her]146-maisie way delicately from stone to stone , a pistol in [her]146-maisie hand and [her]146-maisie teeth firm - set ; and [Maisie]146-maisie in a gray dress sitting on the grass between the mouth of a cannon and a nodding yellow sea - poppy . The pictures passed before [him]147-dick one by one , and the last stayed the longest .

[Dick]147-dick was perfectly happy with a quiet peace that was as new to [his]147-dick mind as it was foreign to [his]147-dick experiences . It never occurred to [him]147-dick that there might be other calls upon [his]147-dick time than loafing across [the Park]812-the park in [the forenoon]844-the forenoon .

' There 's a good working light now , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick said , watching [his]147-dick shadow placidly . ' [Some poor devil]2410-some poor devil ought to be grateful for this . And there 's [Maisie]146-maisie . '[147-dick]

[She]146-maisie was walking towards [him]147-dick from [the Marble Arch]2382-the marble arch , and [he]147-dick saw that no mannerism of [her]146-maisie gait had been changed . It was good to find [her]146-maisie still [Maisie]146-maisie , and , so to speak , [[his]147-dick next - door neighbour]846-his next - door neighbour . No greeting passed between [them]847-them , because there had been none in the old days .

[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow entered [the studio]712-the studio at dusk , and looked at [Dick]147-dick with eyes full of the austere love that springs up between [men who have tugged at the same oar together and are yoked by custom and use and the intimacies of toil]903-men who have tugged at the same oar together and are yoked by custom and use and the intimacies of toil . This is a good love , and , since it allows , and even encourages , strife , recrimination , and brutal sincerity , does not die , but grows , and is proof against any absence and evil conduct .

[Dick]147-dick was silent after [he]147-dick handed [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow the filled pipe of council . [He]147-dick thought of [Maisie]146-maisie and [her]146-maisie possible needs . [He]156-torpenhow could adorn [Maisie]146-maisie barbarically with jewelry , - a thick gold necklace round that little neck , bracelets upon the rounded arms , and rings of price upon [her]146-maisie hands , - the cool , temperate , ringless hands that [he]156-torpenhow had taken between [his]156-torpenhow own . It was an absurd thought , for [Maisie]146-maisie would not even allow [him]156-torpenhow to put one ring on one finger , and [she]146-maisie would laugh at golden trappings . It would be better to sit with [her]146-maisie quietly in the dusk , [his]156-torpenhow arm around [her]146-maisie neck and [her]146-maisie face on [his]156-torpenhow shoulder , as [befitted husband]904-befitted husband and [wife]905-wife .
