' [He]2439-the man that says that we 're all islands shouting lies to each other across seas of misunderstanding 's right , whoever [he]2439-the man that says that we 're all islands shouting lies to each other across seas of misunderstanding is , - except about the misunderstanding . [I]156-torpenhow do n't think [we]2440-we could misunderstand [each other]339-each other . '[156-torpenhow]

The blue smoke curled back from the ceiling in clouds . Then [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , insinuatingly - ' [Dick]147-dick , is it [a woman]730-a woman ? '[156-torpenhow]

' Be hanged if it 's anything remotely resembling [a woman]730-a woman ; and if [you]147-dick begin to talk like that , [I]167-torp 'll hire [a red - brick studio with white paint trimmings , and begonias and petunias and blue Hungarias]2444-a red - brick studio with white paint trimmings , and begonias and petunias and blue hungarias to play among three - and - sixpenny pot - palms , and [I]167-torp 'll mount all [my]167-torp pics in aniline - dye plush plasters , and [I]167-torp 'll invite [every woman who maunders over what [her]2445-every woman who maunders over what her guide guide]2445-every woman who maunders over what her guide - books tell [her]2445-every woman who maunders over what her guide is Art , and [you]147-dick shall receive ['em]2446-'em[167-torp] , [Torp]167-torp , - in a snuff - brown velvet coat with yellow trousers and an orange tie . [You]909-you 'll like that ? '[909-you]

' Too thin , [Dick]147-dick . [A better man than [you]147-dick once denied with cursing and swearing]2447-a better man than you once denied with cursing and swearing . [You]147-dick 've overdone it , just as [he]167-torp did . It 's no business of [mine]167-torp , of course , but it 's comforting to think that somewhere under the stars there 's saving up for [you]147-dick a tremendous thrashing . Whether it 'll come from heaven or [earth]332-earth , [I]910-i do n't know , but it 's bound to come and break [you]147-dick up a little . [You]147-dick want hammering . '[910-i]

[Dick]147-dick shivered . ' All right , '[147-dick] said [he]147-dick . ' When [this island]2449-this island is disintegrated , it will call for [you]147-dick . '[147-dick]

' [I]910-i shall come round the corner and help to disintegrate it some more .[910-i]

[We]910-i 're talking nonsense . Come along to [a theatre]2450-a theatre . '[910-i]

CHAPTER VI

' And [you]911-you may lead [a thousand men]2398-a thousand men , Nor ever draw the rein , But ere [ye]911-you lead [the Faery Queen]2452-the faery queen '[910-i] Twill burst [your]911-you heart in twain . '[911-you]

[He]147-dick has slipped [his]147-dick foot from the stirrup - bar , The bridle from [his]147-dick hand , And [he]147-dick is bound by hand and foot To [the Queen o ' [Faery - land]2454-faery - land]2453-the queen o ' faery - land .[147-dick]

[Sir Hoggie]188-sir hoggie and [the Fairies]192-the fairies . SOME weeks later , on a very foggy Sunday , [Dick]147-dick was returning across [the Park]812-the park to [[his]147-dick studio]2374-his studio . ' This , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick said , ' is evidently the thrashing that [Torp]167-torp meant . It hurts more than [I]147-dick expected ; but [the Queen]883-the queen can do no wrong ; and [she]883-the queen certainly has some notion of drawing . '[147-dick]

[He]147-dick had just finished a Sunday visit to [Maisie]146-maisie , - always under the green eyes of [the red - haired impressionist girl]914-the red - haired impressionist girl , whom [he]147-dick learned to hate at sight , - and was tingling with a keen sense of shame . Sunday after Sunday , putting on [his]147-dick best clothes , [he]147-dick had walked over to [the untidy house north of [the Park]812-the park]915-the untidy house north of the park , first to see [Maisie]146-maisie 's pictures , and then to criticise and advise upon them as [he]147-dick realised that they were productions on which advice would not be wasted . Sunday after Sunday , and [his]147-dick love grew with each visit , [he]147-dick had been compelled to cram [his]147-dick heart back from between [his]147-dick lips when it prompted [him]147-dick to kiss [Maisie]146-maisie several times and very much indeed . Sunday after Sunday , the head above the heart had warned [him]147-dick that [Maisie]146-maisie was not yet attainable , and that it would be better to talk as connectedly as possible upon the mysteries of the craft that was all in all to [her]146-maisie . Therefore it was [his]147-dick fate to endure weekly torture in [the studio]712-the studio built out over [the clammy back garden of [a frail stuffy little villa where nothing was ever in [its]919-a frail stuffy little villa where nothing was ever in its right place and nobody ever called right place and [nobody]670-nobody ever called]919-a frail stuffy little villa where nothing was ever in its right place and nobody ever called]918-the clammy back garden of a frail stuffy little villa where nothing was ever in its right place and nobody ever called , - to endure and to watch [Maisie]146-maisie moving to and fro with the teacups . [He]147-dick abhorred tea , but , since it gave [him]147-dick a little longer time in [her]146-maisie presence , [he]147-dick drank it devoutly , and [the red - haired girl]2429-the red - haired girl sat in an untidy heap and eyed [him]147-dick without speaking . [She]2429-the red - haired girl was always watching [him]147-dick .

Once , and only once , when [she]2429-the red - haired girl had left [the studio]712-the studio , [Maisie]146-maisie showed [him]147-dick an album that held a few poor cuttings from provincial papers , - the briefest of hurried notes on some of [her]146-maisie pictures sent to outlying exhibitions . [Dick]147-dick stooped and kissed the paint - smudged thumb on the open page . ' Oh , [my]147-dick love , [[my]147-dick love]2456-my love , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick muttered , ' do [you]146-maisie value these things ? [Chuck]193-chuck 'em[147-dick] into the waste - paper basket ! '[147-dick]

' Not till [I]146-maisie get something better , '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , shutting the book .

Then [Dick]147-dick , moved by no respect for [his]147-dick public and a very deep regard for [the maiden]923-the maiden , did deliberately propose , in order to secure more of these coveted cuttings , that [he]147-dick should paint a picture which [Maisie]146-maisie should sign .

' That 's childish , '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , ' and [I]146-maisie did n't think it of [you]147-dick . It must be [my]146-maisie work . [Mine]146-maisie , - mine , - mine ! '[146-maisie]

' Go and design decorative medallions for [[rich brewers]2457-rich brewers '[147-dick] houses]2458-rich brewers ' houses . [You]147-dick are thoroughly good at that . ' [Dick]147-dick was sick and savage .[147-dick]

' Better things than medallions , [Dick]147-dick , '[924-a gray - eyed atom] was the answer , in tones that recalled [a gray - eyed atom]924-a gray - eyed atom 's fearless speech to [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett . [Dick]147-dick would have abased [himself]147-dick utterly , but [that other girl]925-that other girl trailed in .

Next Sunday [he]147-dick laid at [Maisie]146-maisie 's feet small gifts of pencils that could almost draw of themselves and colours in whose permanence [he]147-dick believed , and [he]147-dick was ostentatiously attentive to the work in hand . It demanded , among other things , an exposition of the faith that was in [him]147-dick .

[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow 's hair would have stood on end had [he]156-torpenhow heard the fluency with which [Dick]147-dick preached [his]147-dick own gospel of Art .

A month before , [Dick]147-dick would have been equally astonished ; but it was [Maisie]146-maisie 's will and pleasure , and [he]147-dick dragged [his]147-dick words together to make plain to [her]146-maisie comprehension all that had been hidden to [himself]147-dick of the why s and wherefores of work . There is not the least difficulty in doing a thing if [you]926-you only know how to do it ; the trouble is to explain [your]926-you method .

' [I]147-dick could put this right if [I]147-dick had a brush in [my]147-dick hand , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , despairingly , over the modelling of a chin that [Maisie]146-maisie complained would not ' look flesh , '[147-dick] - it was the same chin that [she]146-maisie had scraped out with the palette knife , - ' but [I]147-dick find it almost impossible to teach [you]926-you . There 's a queer grin , Dutch touch about [your]926-you painting that [I]147-dick like ; but [I]147-dick 've a notion that [you]926-you 're[147-dick] weak in drawing . [You]926-you foreshorten as though [you]926-you never used the model , and [you]926-you 've caught [Kami]174-kami 's pasty way of dealing with flesh in shadow . Then , again , though [you]926-you do n't know it [yourself]926-you , [you]926-you shirk hard work . Suppose [you]926-you spend some of [your]926-you time on line alone . [Line]194-line does n't allow of shirking . [Oils]195-oils do , and three square inches of flashy , tricky stuff in the corner of a pic sometimes carry a bad thing off , - as [I]0-i know . That 's immoral . Do line - work for a little while , and then [I]0-i can tell more about [your]926-you powers , as [old Kami]174-kami used to say . '[174-kami]

[Maisie]146-maisie protested ; [she]146-maisie did not care for the pure line .

' [I]147-dick know , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick . ' [You]926-you want to do [your]926-you fancy heads with a bunch of flowers at the base of the neck to hide bad modelling . '[147-dick] [The red - haired girl]2429-the red - haired girl laughed a little . ' [You]926-you want to do landscapes with cattle knee - deep in grass to hide bad drawing . [You]926-you want to do a great deal more than [you]926-you can do . [You]926-you have sense of colour , but [you]926-you want form . Colour 's a gift , - put it aside and think no more about it , - but form [you]926-you can be drilled into .[147-dick]

Now , all [your]926-you fancy heads - and some of them are very good - will keep [you]926-you exactly where [you]926-you are . With line [you]926-you must go forward or backward , and it will show up all [your]926-you weaknesses . '[147-dick]

' But [other people]2459-other people - - '[146-maisie] began [Maisie]146-maisie .

' [You]926-you must n't mind what [other people]2459-other people do . If [their]2459-other people souls were [your]926-you soul , it would be different . [You]926-you stand and fall by [your]926-you own work , remember , and it 's waste of time to think of [any one else in this battle]2461-any one else in this battle . '[146-maisie]

[Dick]147-dick paused , and the longing that had been so resolutely put away came back into [his]147-dick eyes . [He]147-dick looked at [Maisie]146-maisie , and the look asked as plainly as words , Was it not time to leave all this barren wilderness of canvas and counsel and join hands with Life and Love ?

[Maisie]146-maisie assented to the new programme of schooling so adorably that [Dick]147-dick could hardly restrain [himself]147-dick from picking [her]146-maisie up then and there and carrying [her]146-maisie off to [[the nearest registrar]928-the nearest registrar 's office]929-the nearest registrar 's office . It was the implicit obedience to the spoken word and the blank indifference to the unspoken desire that baffled and buffeted [his]147-dick soul . [He]147-dick held authority in [that house]930-that house , - authority limited , indeed , to one - half of one afternoon in seven , but very real while it lasted . [Maisie]146-maisie had learned to appeal to [him]147-dick on many subjects , from the proper packing of pictures to the condition of a smoky chimney . [The red - haired girl]2429-the red - haired girl never consulted [him]147-dick about anything .

On the other hand , [she]2429-the red - haired girl accepted [his]147-dick appearances without protest , and watched [him]147-dick always . [He]147-dick discovered that the meals of [the establishment]932-the establishment were irregular and fragmentary . [They]933-they depended chiefly on tea , pickles , and biscuit , as [he]147-dick had suspected from the beginning . [The girls]651-the girls were supposed to market week and week about , but [they]651-the girls lived , with the help of [a charwoman]935-a charwoman , as casually as [the young ravens]936-the young ravens . [Maisie]146-maisie spent most of [her]146-maisie income on models , and [the other girl]937-the other girl revelled in apparatus as refined as [her]937-the other girl work was rough . Armed with knowledge , dear - bought from [the Docks]660-the docks , [Dick]147-dick warned [Maisie]146-maisie that the end of semi - starvation meant the crippling of power to work , which was considerably worse than death .

[Maisie]146-maisie took the warning , and gave more thought to what [she]146-maisie ate and drank . When [his]147-dick trouble returned upon [him]147-dick , as it generally did in the long winter twilights , the remembrance of that little act of domestic authority and [his]147-dick coercion with a hearth - brush of the smoky drawing - room chimney stung [Dick]147-dick like a whip - lash .

[He]147-dick conceived that this memory would be the extreme of [his]147-dick sufferings , till one Sunday , [the red - haired girl]2429-the red - haired girl announced that [she]2429-the red - haired girl would make a study of [Dick]147-dick 's head , and that [he]147-dick would be good enough to sit still , and - quite as an afterthought - look at [Maisie]146-maisie . [He]147-dick sat , because [he]147-dick could not well refuse , and for the space of half an hour [he]147-dick reflected on [all the people in the past whom [he]147-dick had laid open for the purposes of [his]147-dick own craft]940-all the people in the past whom he had laid open for the purposes of his own craft . [He]147-dick remembered [Binat]162-madame most distinctly , - that Binat who had once been [an artist and talked about degradation]941-an artist and talked about degradation .

It was the merest monochrome roughing in of a head , but it presented the dumb waiting , the longing , and , above all , the hopeless enslavement of [the man]493-the man , in a spirit of bitter mockery .

' [I]147-dick 'll buy it , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , promptly , ' at [your]345-the girl own price . '[147-dick]

' [My]345-the girl price is too high , but [I]345-the girl dare say [you]345-the girl 'll be as grateful if - - '[345-the girl] The wet sketch , fluttered from [the girl]345-the girl 's hand and fell into the ashes of the studio stove . When [she]345-the girl picked it up it was hopelessly smudged .

' Oh , it 's all spoiled ! '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie . ' And [I]146-maisie never saw it . Was it like ? '[146-maisie]

' Thank [you]146-maisie , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick under [his]147-dick breath to [the red - haired girl]2429-the red - haired girl , and [he]147-dick removed [himself]147-dick swiftly .

' How [that man]2272-that man hates [me]345-the girl ! '[345-the girl] said [the girl]345-the girl . ' And how [he]2272-that man loves [you]345-the girl , [Maisie]146-maisie ! '[345-the girl]

' What nonsense ? [I]146-maisie knew [Dick]147-dick 's very fond of [me]146-maisie , but [he]147-dick had [his]147-dick work to do , and [I]146-maisie have [mine]146-maisie . '[146-maisie]

' Yes , [he]147-dick is fond of [you]2429-the red - haired girl , and [I]345-the girl think [he]147-dick knows there is something in impressionism , after all . [Maisie]146-maisie , ca n't [you]2429-the red - haired girl see ? '[345-the girl]

' See ? See what ? '[146-maisie]

' Nothing ; only , [I]345-the girl know that if [I]345-the girl could get [any man]2197-any man to look at [me]345-the girl as [that man]2272-that man looks at [you]2429-the red - haired girl , [I]345-the girl 'd - [I]345-the girl do n't know what [I]345-the girl 'd do . But [he]2272-that man hates [me]345-the girl . Oh , how [he]2272-that man hates [me]345-the girl ! '[345-the girl]

[She]946-she was not altogether correct . [Dick]147-dick 's hatred was tempered with gratitude for a few moments , and then [he]147-dick forgot [the girl]345-the girl entirely . Only the sense of shame remained , and [he]147-dick was nursing it across [the Park]812-the park in the fog . ' There 'll be an explosion one of these days , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick said wrathfully . ' But it is n't [Maisie]146-maisie 's fault ; [she]146-maisie 's right , quite right , as far as [she]146-maisie knows , and [I]147-dick ca n't blame [her]146-maisie . This business has been going on for three months nearly .[147-dick]

Three months ! - and it cost [me]0-i ten years ' knocking about to get at the notion , the merest raw notion , of [my]345-the girl work . That 's true ; but then [I]345-the girl did n't have pins , drawing - pins , and palette - knives , stuck into [me]345-the girl every Sunday .[345-the girl]

Oh , [[my]0-i little darling]949-my little darling , if ever [I]0-i break [you]949-my little darling , [somebody]575-somebody will have a very bad time of it . No , [she]345-the girl wo n't . [I]0-i 'd be as big a fool about [her]345-the girl as [I]0-i am now . [I]0-i 'll poison [that red - haired girl]951-that red - haired girl on [my]0-i wedding - day , - [she]951-that red - haired girl 's unwholesome , - and now [I]0-i 'll pass on these present bad times to [Torp]167-torp . '[167-torp]

[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow had been moved to lecture [Dick]147-dick more than once lately on the sin of levity , and [Dick]147-dick listened and replied not a word . In the weeks between the first few Sundays of [his]147-dick discipline [he]147-dick had flung [himself]147-dick savagely into [his]147-dick work , resolved that [Maisie]146-maisie should at least know the full stretch of [his]147-dick powers . Then [he]147-dick had taught [Maisie]146-maisie that [she]146-maisie must not pay the least attention to any work outside [her]146-maisie own , and [Maisie]146-maisie had obeyed [him]147-dick all too well . [She]146-maisie took [his]147-dick counsels , but was not interested in [his]147-dick pictures .

' [Your]147-dick things smell of tobacco and blood , '[146-maisie] [she]146-maisie said once . ' Ca n't [you]147-dick do anything except [soldiers]2465-soldiers ? '[146-maisie]

' [I]147-dick could do a head of [you]156-torpenhow that would startle [you]156-torpenhow , '[147-dick] thought [Dick]147-dick , - this was before [the red - haired girl]2429-the red - haired girl had brought [him]147-dick under the guillotine , - but [he]147-dick only said , ' [I]147-dick am very sorry , '[147-dick] and harrowed [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow 's soul that evening with blasphemies against [Art]166-art . Later , insensibly and to a large extent against [his]147-dick own will , [he]147-dick ceased to interest [himself]147-dick in [his]147-dick own work .

For [Maisie]146-maisie 's sake , and to soothe the self - respect that it seemed to [him]147-dick [he]147-dick lost each Sunday , [he]147-dick would not consciously turn out bad stuff , but , since [Maisie]146-maisie did not care even for [his]147-dick best , it were better not to do anything at all save wait and mark time between Sunday and Sunday . [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow was disgusted as the weeks went by fruitless , and then attacked [him]147-dick one Sunday evening when [Dick]147-dick felt utterly exhausted after three hours ' biting self - restraint in [Maisie]146-maisie 's presence . There was Language , and [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow withdrew to consult [the Nilghai]2383-the nilghai , who had come in to talk continental politics .[156-torpenhow]

' Bone - idle , is [he]156-torpenhow ? Careless , and touched in the temper ? '[177-the nilghai] said [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai .

' It is n't worth worrying over . [Dick]147-dick is probably playing [the fool]2467-the fool with [a woman]730-a woman . '[156-torpenhow]

' Is n't that bad enough ? '[177-the nilghai]

' No . [She]730-a woman may throw [him]147-dick out of gear and knock [his]147-dick work to pieces for a while . [She]730-a woman may even turn up [here]2226-here some day and make a scene on the staircase : [one]727-one never knows . But until [Dick]147-dick speaks of [his]147-dick own accord [you]2471-you had better not touch [him]147-dick . [He]147-dick is [no easy - tempered man]2472-no easy - tempered man to handle . '[156-torpenhow]

' No ; [I]177-the nilghai wish [he]147-dick were . [He]147-dick is such [an aggressive , cocksure , you - be - damned fellow]2473-an aggressive , cocksure , you - be - damned fellow . '[177-the nilghai]

' [He]147-dick 'll get that knocked out of [him]147-dick in time . [He]147-dick must learn that [he]147-dick ca n't storm up and down [the world]327-the world with a box of moist tubes and a slick brush .[156-torpenhow]

[You]953-you 're fond of [him]147-dick ? '[156-torpenhow]

' [I]177-the nilghai 'd take any punishment that 's in store for [him]147-dick if [I]177-the nilghai could ; but the worst of it is , [no man]420-no man can save [[his]420-no man brother]2476-his brother . '[177-the nilghai]

' No , and the worser of it is , there is no discharge in this war . [Dick]147-dick must learn [his]147-dick lesson like [the rest of [us]2478-us]2477-the rest of us . Talking of war , there 'll be trouble in [the Balkans]48-the balkans in the spring . '[156-torpenhow]

' That trouble is long coming . [I]177-the nilghai wonder if [we]2478-us could drag [Dick]147-dick out there when it comes off ? '[177-the nilghai]

[Dick]147-dick entered [the room]397-the room soon afterwards , and the question was put to [him]147-dick .

' Not good enough , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick said shortly . ' [I]147-dick 'm[147-dick] too comf'y where [I]0-i am . '[177-the nilghai]

' Surely [you]147-dick are n't taking all the stuff in the papers seriously ? '[177-the nilghai] said [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai . ' [Your]147-dick vogue will be ended in less than six months , - [the public]692-the public will know [your]147-dick touch and go on to something new , - and where will [you]147-dick be then ? '[177-the nilghai]

' Here , in [England]18-england . '[177-the nilghai]

' When [you]147-dick might be doing decent work among [us]2478-us out there ? Nonsense ! [I]177-the nilghai shall go , [the Keneu]183-the keneu will be there , [Torp]167-torp will be there , [Cassavetti]176-cassavetti will be [there]2480-there , and [the whole lot of [us]2478-us]2481-the whole lot of us will be there , and [we]2478-us shall have as much as ever [we]2478-us can do , with unlimited fighting and the chance for [you]147-dick of seeing things that would make the reputation of [three Verestchagins]2482-three verestchagins . '[177-the nilghai]

' Um ! '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , pulling at [his]147-dick pipe .

' [You]147-dick prefer to stay [here]2226-here and imagine that all [the world]327-the world is gaping at [your]147-dick pictures ? Just think how full [an average man]2485-an average man 's life is of [his]2485-an average man own pursuits and pleasures . When [twenty thousand of [him]2485-an average man]2486-twenty thousand of him find time to look up between mouthfuls and grunt something about something [they]2486-twenty thousand of him are n't the least interested in , the net result is called fame , reputation , or notoriety , according to the taste and fancy of [the speller [my]177-the nilghai lord]2487-the speller my lord . '[177-the nilghai]

' [I]177-the nilghai know that as well as [you]147-dick do . Give [me]177-the nilghai credit for a little gumption . '[177-the nilghai]

' Be hanged if [I]177-the nilghai do ! '[177-the nilghai]

' Be hanged , then ; [you]147-dick probably will be , - for [a spy]2488-a spy , by [excited Turks]2489-excited turks .[177-the nilghai]

Heigh - ho ! [I]0-i 'm weary , dead weary , and virtue has gone out of [me]177-the nilghai . '[177-the nilghai] [Dick]147-dick dropped into a chair , and was fast asleep in a minute .

' That 's a bad sign , '[177-the nilghai] said [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai , in an undertone .

[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow picked the pipe from the waistcoat where it was beginning to burn , and put a pillow behind the head . ' [We]2490-we ca n't help ; [we]2490-we ca n't help , '[156-torpenhow] [he]156-torpenhow said . ' It 's a good ugly sort of old cocoanut , and [I]156-torpenhow 'm[156-torpenhow] fond of it . There 's the scar of the wipe [he]156-torpenhow got when [he]156-torpenhow was cut over in [the square]524-the square . '[156-torpenhow]

' Should n't wonder if that has made [him]156-torpenhow a trifle mad . '[2383-the nilghai]

' [I]156-torpenhow should . [He]156-torpenhow 's [a most businesslike madman]2491-a most businesslike madman . '[156-torpenhow]

Then [Dick]147-dick began to snore furiously .

' Oh , here , [no affection]2492-no affection can stand this sort of thing . Wake up , [Dick]147-dick , and go and sleep somewhere else , if [you]147-dick intend to make a noise about it . '[156-torpenhow]

' When a cat has been out on the tiles all night , '[2383-the nilghai] said [the Nilghai]2383-the nilghai , in [his]2383-the nilghai beard , ' [I]2383-the nilghai notice that [she]146-maisie usually sleeps all day . This is natural history . '[2383-the nilghai]

[Dick]147-dick staggered away rubbing [his]147-dick eyes and yawning . In the night - watches [he]147-dick was overtaken with an idea , so simple and so luminous that [he]147-dick wondered [he]147-dick had never conceived it before . It was full of craft . [He]147-dick would seek [Maisie]146-maisie on a week - day , - would suggest an excursion , and would take [her]146-maisie by [train]957-train to [Fort Keeling]2-fort keeling , over the very ground that [they]958-they two had trodden together ten years ago .

' As a general rule , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick explained to [his]147-dick chin - lathered reflection in the morning , ' it is n't safe to cross [an old trail]2493-an old trail twice . Things remind one of things , and a cold wind gets up , and [you]2494-you feel sad ; but this is an exception to every rule that ever was . [I]147-dick 'll go to [Maisie]146-maisie at once . '[147-dick]

Fortunately , [the red - haired girl]2429-the red - haired girl was out shopping when [he]147-dick arrived , and [Maisie]146-maisie in a paint - spattered blouse was warring with [her]146-maisie canvas . [She]146-maisie was not pleased to see [him]147-dick ; for week - day visits were a stretch of the bond ; and it needed all [his]147-dick courage to explain [his]147-dick errand .

' [I]147-dick know [you]146-maisie 've been working too hard , '[147-dick] [he]147-dick concluded , with an air of authority . ' If [you]146-maisie do that , [you]146-maisie 'll break down . [You]146-maisie had much better come . '[147-dick]

' Where ? '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , wearily . [She]146-maisie had been standing before [her]146-maisie easel too long , and was very tired .

' Anywhere [you]147-dick please . [We]2495-we 'll take [a train]2496-a train to - morrow and see where it stops . [We]2495-we 'll have lunch somewhere , and [I]147-dick 'll bring [you]146-maisie back in the evening . '[147-dick]

' If there 's a good working light to - morrow , [I]146-maisie lose a day . '[146-maisie] [Maisie]146-maisie balanced the heavy white chestnut palette irresolutely .

[Dick]147-dick bit back an oath that was hurrying to [his]147-dick lips . [He]147-dick had not yet learned patience with [the maiden to whom [her]960-the maiden to whom her work was all in all work was all in all]960-the maiden to whom her work was all in all .

' [You]146-maisie 'll lose ever so many more , [dear]2419-dear , if [you]146-maisie use every hour of working light . Overwork 's only murderous idleness . Do n't be unreasonable . [I]147-dick 'll call for [you]146-maisie to - morrow after breakfast early . '[147-dick]

' But surely [you]147-dick are going to ask - - '[146-maisie]

' No , [I]147-dick am not . [I]147-dick want [you]146-maisie and [nobody else]2498-nobody else . Besides , [she]146-maisie hates [me]147-dick as much as [I]147-dick hate [her]146-maisie . [She]146-maisie wo n't care to come . To - morrow , then ; and pray that [we]2499-we get sunshine . '[147-dick]

[Dick]147-dick went away delighted , and by consequence did no work whatever .

[He]147-dick strangled a wild desire to order [a special train]961-a special train , but bought a great gray kangaroo cloak lined with glossy black marten , and then retired into [himself]147-dick to consider things .

' [I]146-maisie 'm[146-maisie] going out for the day to - morrow with [Dick]147-dick , ' said [Maisie]146-maisie to [the red - haired girl]2429-the red - haired girl when [the latter]487-the latter returned , tired , from marketing in [the Edgware road]2502-the edgware road .[146-maisie]

' [He]147-dick deserves it . [I]146-maisie shall have [the studio]712-the studio floor thoroughly scrubbed while [you]2429-the red - haired girl 're[146-maisie] away . It 's very dirty . '[146-maisie]

[Maisie]146-maisie had enjoyed no sort of holiday for months and looked forward to the little excitement , but not without misgivings .

' There 's nobody nicer than [Dick]147-dick when [he]147-dick talks sensibly , [she]146-maisie though , but [I]147-dick 'm[147-dick] sure [he]147-dick 'll be silly and worry [me]0-i , and [I]0-i 'm sure [I]147-dick ca n't tell [him]147-dick anything [he]147-dick 'd like to hear . If [he]147-dick 'd only be sensible , [I]147-dick should like [him]147-dick so much better . '[147-dick]

[Dick]147-dick 's eyes were full of joy when [he]147-dick made [his]147-dick appearance next morning and saw [Maisie]146-maisie , gray - ulstered and black - velvet - hatted , standing in [the hallway]962-the hallway . Palaces of marble , and not sordid imitation of grained wood , were surely the fittest background for such a divinity . [The red - haired girl]2429-the red - haired girl drew [her]146-maisie into [the studio]712-the studio for a moment and kissed [her]146-maisie hurriedly .

[Maisie]146-maisie 's eyebrows climbed to the top of [her]146-maisie forehead ; [she]146-maisie was altogether unused to these demonstrations . ' Mind [my]146-maisie hat , '[146-maisie] [she]146-maisie said , hurrying away , and ran down the steps to [Dick]147-dick waiting by [the hansom]965-the hansom .

' Are [you]147-dick quite warm enough ! Are [you]147-dick sure [you]147-dick would n't like some more breakfast ? Put the cloak over [your]147-dick knees . '[146-maisie]

' [I]146-maisie 'm[146-maisie] quite comf'y , thanks . Where are [we]966-we going , [Dick]147-dick ? Oh , do stop singing like that . [People]2276-people will think [we]966-we 're mad . '[147-dick]

' Let ['em]966-we[147-dick] think , - if the exertion does n't kill [them]2276-people . [They]2276-people do n't know who [we]966-we are , and [I]0-i 'm sure [I]2276-people do n't care who [they]2276-people are . [My]2276-people faith , [Maisie]146-maisie , [you]146-maisie 're[2276-people] looking lovely ! '[2276-people]

[Maisie]146-maisie stared directly in front of [her]146-maisie and did not reply . The wind of a keen clear winter morning had put colour into [her]146-maisie cheeks . Overhead , the creamy - yellow smoke - clouds were thinning away one by one against a pale - blue sky , and the improvident sparrows broke off from water - spout committees and [cab - rank cabals]968-cab - rank cabals to clamour of the coming of spring .

' It will be lovely weather in [the country]2271-the country , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick .

' But where are [we]2505-we going ? '[147-dick]

' Wait and see . '[147-dick]

The stopped at [Victoria]58-victoria , and [Dick]147-dick sought tickets . For less than half the fraction of an instant it occurred to [Maisie]146-maisie , comfortably settled by the waiting - room fire , that it was much more pleasant to send [a man]308-a man to [the booking - office]970-the booking - office than to elbow one 's own way through [the crowd]855-the crowd . [Dick]147-dick put [her]146-maisie into [a Pullman]972-a pullman , - solely on account of the warmth there ; and [she]146-maisie regarded the extravagance with grave scandalised eyes as [the train]973-the train moved out into [the country]2271-the country .

' [I]146-maisie wish [I]146-maisie knew where [we]2505-we are going , '[146-maisie] [she]146-maisie repeated for the twentieth time .

The name of [a well - remembered station]975-a well - remembered station flashed by , towards the end of the run , and [Maisie]146-maisie was delighted .

' Oh , [Dick]147-dick , [you]147-dick villain ! '[146-maisie]

' Well , [I]146-maisie thought [you]147-dick might like to see [the place]700-the place again . [You]147-dick have n't been [here]2226-here since the old times , have [you]147-dick ? '[146-maisie]

' No . [I]146-maisie never cared to see [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett again ; and [she]148-mrs. jennett was all that was ever [there]2480-there . '[146-maisie]

' Not quite . Look out a minute . There 's [the windmill above [the potato - fields]2510-the potato - fields]2509-the windmill above the potato - fields ; [they]2511-they have n't built [villas]2512-villas [there]2480-there yet ; d'you remember when [I]146-maisie shut [you]147-dick up in [it]2480-there ? '[146-maisie]

' Yes . How [she]148-mrs. jennett beat [you]147-dick for it ! [I]146-maisie never told it was [you]147-dick . '[146-maisie]

' [She]148-mrs. jennett guessed . [I]146-maisie jammed a stick under the door and told [you]147-dick that [I]146-maisie was burying [Amomma]149-amomma alive in the potatoes , and [you]147-dick believed [me]146-maisie . [You]147-dick had a trusting nature in those days . '[146-maisie]

[They]976-they laughed and leaned to look out , identifying ancient landmarks with many reminiscences . [Dick]147-dick fixed [his]147-dick weather eye on the curve of [Maisie]146-maisie 's cheek , very near [his]147-dick own , and watched the blood rise under the clear skin . [He]147-dick congratulated [himself]147-dick upon [his]147-dick cunning , and looked that the evening would bring [him]147-dick a great reward .

When [the train]973-the train stopped [they]976-they went out to look at [an old town]978-an old town with new eyes . First , but from a distance , [they]976-they regarded [the house of [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett]979-the house of mrs. jennett .

' Suppose [she]146-maisie should come out now , what would [you]147-dick do ? '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , with mock terror .

' [I]147-dick should make a face . '[147-dick]

' Show , then , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , dropping into the speech of childhood .

[Maisie]146-maisie made that face in the direction of [the mean little villa]980-the mean little villa , and [Dick]147-dick laughed .

' " This is disgraceful , " '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , mimicking [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett 's tone .

' " [Maisie]146-maisie , [you]146-maisie run in at once , and learn the collect , gospel , and epistle for the next three Sundays . After all [I]147-dick 've taught [you]146-maisie , too , and three helps every Sunday at dinner ! [Dick]147-dick 's always leading [you]146-maisie into mischief . If [you]146-maisie are n't [a gentleman]2190-a gentleman , [Dick]147-dick , [you]146-maisie might at least - " '[147-dick]

The sentence ended abruptly . [Maisie]146-maisie remembered when it had last been used .

' " Try to behave like [one]727-one , " '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , promptly . ' Quite right . Now [we]981-we 'll get some lunch and go on to [Fort Keeling]2-fort keeling , - unless [you]147-dick 'd rather drive [there]2480-there ? '[147-dick]

' [We]981-we must walk , out of respect to [the place]700-the place . How little changed it all is ! '[981-we]

[They]981-we turned in the direction of [the sea]2168-the sea through [unaltered streets]983-unaltered streets , and the influence of old things lay upon [them]981-we . Presently [they]981-we passed [[a confectioner]984-a confectioner 's shop]985-a confectioner 's shop much considered in the days when [their]981-we joint pocket - money amounted to a shilling a week .

' [Dick]147-dick , have [you]147-dick any pennies ? '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , half to [herself]146-maisie .

' Only three ; and if [you]147-dick think [you]147-dick 're[986-she] going to have two of 'em to buy peppermints with , [you]147-dick 're[986-she] wrong . [She]986-she says peppermints are n't ladylike . '[986-she]

Again [they]981-we laughed , and again the colour came into [Maisie]146-maisie 's cheeks as the blood boiled through [Dick]147-dick 's heart . After a large lunch [they]981-we went down to [the beach]347-the beach and to [Fort Keeling]2-fort keeling across [the waste , wind - bitten land]988-the waste , wind - bitten land that [no builder]989-no builder had thought it worth [his]989-no builder while to defile . The winter breeze came in from [the sea]2168-the sea and sang about [their]981-we ears .

' [Maisie]146-maisie , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , ' [your]146-maisie nose is getting a crude Prussian blue at the tip .[147-dick]

[I]0-i 'll race [you]146-maisie as far as [you]146-maisie please for as much as [you]146-maisie please . '[0-i]

[She]146-maisie looked round cautiously , and with a laugh set off , swiftly as the ulster allowed , till [she]146-maisie was out of breath .

' [We]981-we used to run miles , '[146-maisie] [she]146-maisie panted . ' It 's absurd that [we]981-we ca n't run now . '[146-maisie]

' Old age , [dear]2419-dear . This it is to get fat and sleek in [town]754-town . When [I]146-maisie wished to pull [your]146-maisie hair [you]146-maisie generally ran for three miles , shrieking at the top of [your]146-maisie voice . [I]146-maisie ought to know , because those shrieks of [yours]146-maisie were meant to call up [Mrs. Jennett]148-mrs. jennett with a cane and - - '[146-maisie]

' [Dick]147-dick , [I]146-maisie never got [you]147-dick a beating on purpose in [my]146-maisie life . '[146-maisie]

' No , of course [you]147-dick never did . Good heavens ! look at [the sea]2168-the sea . '[146-maisie]

' Why , it 's the same as ever ! '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie .

[Torpenhow]156-torpenhow had gathered from [Mr. Beeton]189-mr. beeton that [Dick]147-dick , properly dressed and shaved , had left [the house]330-the house at half - past eight in the morning with a travelling - rug over [his]147-dick arm . [The Nilghai]177-the nilghai rolled in at mid - day for chess and polite conversation .

' It 's worse than anything [I]156-torpenhow imagined , '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow .

' Oh , the everlasting [Dick]147-dick , [I]156-torpenhow suppose ! [You]147-dick fuss over [him]147-dick like a hen with [one chick]2521-one chick . Let [him]147-dick run riot if [he]147-dick thinks it 'll amuse [him]147-dick . [You]147-dick can whip [a young pup]2522-a young pup off feather , but [you]147-dick ca n't whip [a young man]456-a young man . '[156-torpenhow]

' It is n't [a woman]730-a woman . It 's [one woman]2244-one woman ; and it 's [a girl]2375-a girl . '[189-mr. beeton]

' Where 's [your]992-your proof ? '[156-torpenhow]

' [He]993-he got up and went out at eight this morning , - got up in the middle of the night , by [Jove]184-jove ! a thing [he]993-he never does except when [he]993-he 's on service .[189-mr. beeton]

Even then , remember , [we]992-your had to kick [him]993-he out of [his]993-he blankets before the fight began at [El - Maghrib]47-el - maghrib . It 's disgusting . '[156-torpenhow]

' It looks odd ; but maybe [he]993-he 's decided to buy a horse at last . [He]993-he might get up for that , might n't [he]993-he ? '[156-torpenhow]

' Buy a blazing wheelbarrow ! [He]993-he 'd have told [us]992-your if there was a horse in the wind . It 's [a girl]2375-a girl . '[156-torpenhow]

' Do n't be certain . Perhaps it 's only [a married woman]2528-a married woman . '[156-torpenhow]

' [Dick]147-dick has some sense of humour , if [you]2529-you have n't . Who gets up in the gray dawn to call on [[another man]2530-another man 's wife]2531-another man 's wife ? It 's [a girl]2375-a girl . '[156-torpenhow]

' Let it be [a girl]2375-a girl , then . [She]2375-a girl may teach [him]993-he that there 's [somebody else in [the world]327-the world besides [himself]993-he]2534-somebody else in the world besides himself . '[156-torpenhow]

' [She]2375-a girl 'll spoil [his]993-he hand . [She]2375-a girl 'll waste [his]993-he time , and [she]2375-a girl 'll marry [him]993-he , and ruin [his]993-he work for ever . [He]993-he 'll be [a respectable married man]2536-a respectable married man before [we]2537-we can stop [him]993-he , and - [he]993-he 'll ever go on the long trail again . '[156-torpenhow]

' All quite possible , but the earth wo n't spin the other way when that happens .... No ! ho ! [I]156-torpenhow 'd give something to see [Dick]147-dick " go wooing with [the boys]326-the boys . " Do n't worry about it . These things be with [Allah]196-allah , and [we]2537-we can only look on . Get [the chessmen]2539-the chessmen . '[156-torpenhow]

[The red - haired girl]2429-the red - haired girl was lying down in [[her]2429-the red - haired girl own room]995-her own room , staring at the ceiling . The footsteps of [people on the pavement]996-people on the pavement sounded , as [they]996-people on the pavement grew indistinct in the distance , like a many - times - repeated kiss that was all one long kiss . [Her]2429-the red - haired girl hands were by [her]2429-the red - haired girl side , and they opened and shut savagely from time to time .

[The charwoman in charge of the scrubbing of the studio]997-the charwoman in charge of the scrubbing of the studio knocked at [her]2429-the red - haired girl door : ' Beg [y]998-miss '[997-the charwoman in charge of the scrubbing of the studio] pardon , [miss]998-miss , but in cleanin ' of [a floor]2540-a floor there 's two , not to say three , kind of soap , which is yaller , an '[997-the charwoman in charge of the scrubbing of the studio] mottled , an ' disinfectink .[997-the charwoman in charge of the scrubbing of the studio]

Now , jist before [I]0-i took [my]0-i pail into [the passage]999-the passage [I]0-i thought it would be pre'aps jest as well if [I]0-i was to come up ' ere an '[998-miss] ask [you]998-miss what sort of soap [you]998-miss was wishful that [I]0-i should use on them boards . The yaller soap , [miss]998-miss - - '[998-miss]

There was nothing in the speech to have caused the paroxysm of fury that drove [the red - haired girl]2429-the red - haired girl into the middle of [the room]397-the room , almost shouting - ' Do [you]1003-the woman suppose [I]2429-the red - haired girl care what [you]1003-the woman use ? Any kind will do ! - any kind ! '[2429-the red - haired girl]

[The woman]1003-the woman fled , and [the red - haired girl]2429-the red - haired girl looked at [her]2429-the red - haired girl own reflection in the glass for an instant and covered [her]2429-the red - haired girl face with [her]2429-the red - haired girl hands . It was as though [she]2429-the red - haired girl had shouted some shameless secret aloud .

CHAPTER VII

Roses red and roses white Plucked [I]0-i for [my]0-i love 's delight .

[She]1005-she would none of all [my]0-i posies , - Bade [me]0-i gather [her]1005-she blue roses .

Half [the world]327-the world [I]0-i wandered through , Seeking where such flowers grew ; Half [the world]327-the world unto [my]0-i quest Answered but with laugh and jest .

It may be beyond the grave [She]1005-she shall find what [she]1005-she would have .

[Mine]0-i was but an idle quest , - Roses white and red are best ! - Blue Roses [THE SEA]60-the sea had not changed . [[Its]60-the sea waters]1008-its waters were low on [the mud - banks]1009-the mud - banks , and [the Marazion Bell - buoy]2169-the marazion bell - buoy clanked and swung in the tide - way . On [the white beach]1011-the white beach - sand dried stumps of sea - poppy shivered and chattered .

' [I]146-maisie do n't see [the old breakwater]2541-the old breakwater , '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , under [her]146-maisie breath .

' Let 's be thankful that [we]1012-we have as much as [we]1012-we have . [I]146-maisie do n't believe [they]2542-they 've mounted a single new gun on [the fort]383-the fort since [we]1012-we were [here]2226-here . Come and look . '[146-maisie]

[They]1012-we came to [the glacis of [Fort Keeling]2-fort keeling]1013-the glacis of fort keeling , and sat down in [a nook sheltered from the wind under the tarred throat of a forty - pounder cannon]1014-a nook sheltered from the wind under the tarred throat of a forty - pounder cannon .

' Now , if [Ammoma]197-ammoma were only [here]2226-here ! '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie .

For a long time [both]1015-both were silent . Then [Dick]147-dick took [Maisie]146-maisie 's hand and called [her]146-maisie by [her]146-maisie name .

[She]146-maisie shook [her]146-maisie head and looked out to [sea]1016-sea .

' [Maisie]146-maisie , [darling]2178-darling , does n't it make any difference ? '[146-maisie]

' No ! '[147-dick] between clenched teeth . ' [I]147-dick 'd - [I]147-dick 'd tell [you]147-dick if it did ; but it does n't , Oh , [Dick]147-dick , please be sensible . '[147-dick]

' Do n't [you]147-dick think that it ever will ? '[146-maisie]

' No , [I]147-dick 'm[147-dick] sure it wo n't . '[147-dick]

' Why ? '[146-maisie]

[Maisie]146-maisie rested [her]146-maisie chin on [her]146-maisie hand , and , still regarding [the sea]2168-the sea , spoke hurriedly - ' [I]146-maisie know what [you]147-dick want perfectly well , but [I]146-maisie ca n't give it to [you]147-dick , [Dick]147-dick . It is n't [my]146-maisie fault ; indeed , it is n't . If [I]146-maisie felt that [I]146-maisie could care for [any one]2547-any one - - But [I]146-maisie do n't feel that [I]146-maisie care . [I]146-maisie simply do n't understand what the feeling means . '[146-maisie]

' Is that true , [dear]2419-dear ? '[146-maisie]

' [You]2419-dear 've been very good to [me]146-maisie , [Dickie]175-dickie ; and the only way [I]146-maisie can pay [you]2419-dear back is by speaking the truth . [I]146-maisie dare n't tell [a fib]2549-a fib . [I]146-maisie despise [myself]146-maisie quite enough as it is . '[146-maisie]

' What in [the world]327-the world for ? '[146-maisie]

' Because - because [I]146-maisie take everything that [you]2419-dear give [me]146-maisie and [I]146-maisie give [you]2419-dear nothing in return . It 's mean and selfish of [me]146-maisie , and whenever [I]146-maisie think of it it worries [me]146-maisie . '[146-maisie]

' Understand once for all , then , that [I]146-maisie can manage [my]146-maisie own affairs , and if [I]146-maisie choose to do anything [you]2419-dear are n't to blame . [You]2419-dear have n't a single thing to reproach [yourself]2419-dear with , [darling]2178-darling . '[146-maisie]

' Yes , [I]146-maisie have , and talking only makes it worse . '[146-maisie]

' Then do n't talk about it . '[146-maisie]

' How can [I]146-maisie help [myself]146-maisie ? If [you]2419-dear find [me]146-maisie alone for a minute [you]2419-dear are always talking about it ; and when [you]2419-dear are n't [you]2419-dear look it . ' Great goodness ! '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , nearly jumping to [his]147-dick feet . ' Speak the truth now , [Maisie]146-maisie , if [you]146-maisie never speak it again ! Do [I]147-dick - does this worrying bore [you]2419-dear ? '[147-dick]

' No . [It]2552-it does not . '[146-maisie]

' [You]147-dick 'd tell [me]147-dick if it did ? '[147-dick]

[Maisie]146-maisie did not consider the last question worth answering , and [Dick]147-dick was forced to repeat it .

' There were [other men]2555-other men , of course . [They]2555-other men always worried just when [I]146-maisie was in the middle of [my]146-maisie work , and wanted [me]146-maisie to listen to [them]2555-other men . '[146-maisie]

'[0-i]

' But surely [one]727-one can do that sometimes ? '[1032-you]

' Who is afraid ? - [you]1032-you , or the sun ? '[1032-you]

'[1036-half a gipsy]

'[1036-half a gipsy]

[He]0-i had risen to [his]0-i feet , and stood in the shadow of the gun , looking down at [the girl]345-the girl . Long ruled lines of silver showed where a ripple of the rising tide was turning over [the mud - banks]1009-the mud - banks . The wind had dropped , and in the intense stillness [they]1039-they could hear a donkey cropping the frosty grass many yards away . A faint beating , like that of a muffled drum , came out of the moon - haze .

' What 's that ? '[146-maisie] said [Maisie]146-maisie , quickly . ' It sounds like a heart beating .[146-maisie]

Where is it ? '[146-maisie]

[Dick]147-dick was so angry at this sudden wrench to [his]147-dick pleadings that [he]147-dick could not trust [himself]147-dick to speak , and in this silence caught the sound . [Maisie]146-maisie from [her]146-maisie seat under the gun watched [him]0-i with a certain amount of fear .

[She]146-maisie wished so much that [he]0-i would be sensible and cease to worry [her]146-maisie with over - sea emotion that [she]146-maisie both could and could not understand . [She]146-maisie was not prepared , however , for the change in [his]0-i face as [he]0-i listened .

'[0-i]

[He]147-dick stared intently , and moved up the slope of [the fort]383-the fort to get a better view , but the mist on [the sea]2168-the sea thickened again , and the beating of the screws grew fainter . But [I]0-i ca n't help [you]0-i ; even [I]0-i ca n't help . '[0-i]

A murmur of dissent from [Maisie]146-maisie . [He]0-i went on - ' And [I]0-i know by what [you]146-maisie have just said that [you]146-maisie 're[0-i] on the wrong road to success . '[0-i]

' How can [you]0-i believe all that ? '[0-i]

' There 's no question of belief or disbelief . That 's the law , and [you]0-i take it or refuse it as [you]0-i please . [I]0-i try to obey , but [I]0-i ca n't , and then [my]0-i work turns bad on [my]0-i hands . Under any circumstances , remember , four - fifths of [everybody]2627-everybody 's work must be bad . But the remnant is worth the trouble for its own sake . '[0-i]

' Is n't it nice to get credit even for bad work ? '[0-i]

' It 's much too nice . But - - May [I]308-a man tell [you]0-i something ? It is n't a pretty tale , but [you]0-i 're[308-a man] so like [a man]308-a man that [I]0-i forget when [I]0-i 'm talking to [you]0-i . '[0-i]

' Tell [me]0-i . '[0-i]

' Once when [I]0-i was out in [the Soudan]45-the soudan [I]0-i went over some ground that [we]2628-we had been fighting on for three days . There were twelve hundred dead ; and [we]2628-we had n't time to bury [them]2629-them . '[0-i]

' How ghastly ! '[0-i]

' [I]0-i had been at work on a big double - sheet sketch , and [I]0-i was wondering what [people]2276-people would think of it at [home]2172-home . ' [Dick]147-dick , that 's disgraceful ! '[0-i]

' In [your]1052-i case [I]1052-i do n't . [You]1052-i are n't [a woman]730-a woman . But [ordinary people]2640-ordinary people , [Maisie]146-maisie , must behave and work as such . That 's what makes [me]1052-i so savage . '[1052-i] [He]1052-i hurled a pebble towards [the sea]2168-the sea as [he]1052-i spoke . '[1052-i]

' And when [he]308-a man does n't say pretty things ? '[0-i]

' Then , [belovedest]2643-belovedest , '[147-dick] - [Dick]147-dick grinned , - ' [I]147-dick forget that [I]147-dick am [the steward of these gifts]2644-the steward of these gifts , and [I]147-dick want to make [that man]2272-that man love and appreciate [my]147-dick work with a thick stick . To [each man]1061-each man is appointed [his]1061-each man particular dread , - the terror that , if [he]1061-each man does not fight against it , must cow [him]1061-each man even to the loss of [his]1061-each man manhood . [His]147-dick burden was heavier than the burdens of [[his]147-dick companions]1066-his companions .

[Maisie]146-maisie watched the face working in the moonlight .

' [You]147-dick 've plenty of pennies now , '[146-maisie] [she]146-maisie said soothingly .

' Why threepence ? '[146-maisie]

' [I]146-maisie carried [a man]308-a man 's bag once from [Liverpool Street Station]67-liverpool street station to [Blackfriar 's Bridge]68-blackfriar 's bridge . A light frost lay white on the shoulder of [Dick]147-dick 's ulster . [He]147-dick , too , had forgotten the state of the weather . [They]1070-they laughed together , and with that laugh ended all serious discourse .

' But [you]147-dick said on [the beach]347-the beach - - '[146-maisie] persisted [Maisie]146-maisie , with a certain fear .

[I]147-dick can just see that it is n't everything to all [the world]327-the world . Do what [I]147-dick say , and not what [I]147-dick do . '[147-dick]

[Maisie]146-maisie was careful not to reopen debatable matters , and [they]1102-they returned to [London]33-london joyously . [The terminus]1103-the terminus stopped [Dick]147-dick in the midst of an eloquent harangue on the beauties of exercise . [He]147-dick would buy [Maisie]146-maisie a horse , - such a horse as never yet bowed head to bit , - would stable [it]1104-it , with a companion , some twenty miles from [London]33-london , and [Maisie]146-maisie , solely for [her]146-maisie health 's sake should ride with [him]147-dick twice or thrice a week .

' That 's absurd , '[146-maisie] said [she]146-maisie . ' It would n't be proper . '[146-maisie]

' Now , who in all [London]33-london to - night would have sufficient interest or audacity to call [us]1102-they two to account for anything [we]1102-they chose to do ? '[146-maisie]

[Maisie]146-maisie looked at the lamps , the fog , and the hideous turmoil . [Dick]147-dick was right ; but horseflesh did not make for Art as [she]146-maisie understood it .

' [You]146-maisie 're[147-dick] very nice sometimes , but [you]146-maisie 're very foolish more times . [I]147-dick 'm[147-dick] not going to let [you]146-maisie give [me]0-i horses , or take [you]146-maisie out of [your]146-maisie way to - night . [I]0-i 'll go [home]2172-home by [myself]0-i . Only [I]0-i want [you]146-maisie to promise [me]0-i something . [You]146-maisie wo n't think any more about that extra threepence , will [you]146-maisie ? Remember , [you]146-maisie 've been paid ; and [I]0-i wo n't allow [you]146-maisie to be spiteful and do bad work for a little thing like that . [You]146-maisie can be so big that [you]146-maisie must n't be tiny . '[146-maisie]

This was turning the tables with a vengeance . There remained only to put [Maisie]146-maisie into [her]146-maisie hansom .

' Good - bye , '[146-maisie] [she]146-maisie said simply . ' [You]0-i 'll come on Sunday . It has been a beautiful day , [Dick]147-dick . Why ca n't it be like this always ? '[146-maisie]

' Because love 's like line - work : [you]146-maisie must go forward or backward ; [you]146-maisie ca n't stand still . By the way , go on with [your]146-maisie line - work . Good - night , and , for [my]146-maisie - for [my]146-maisie sake , take care of [yourself]146-maisie . '[146-maisie]

[He]0-i turned to walk [home]2172-home , meditating . The day had brought [him]0-i nothing that [he]0-i hoped for , but - surely this was worth many days - it had brought [him]0-i nearer to [Maisie]146-maisie . The end was only a question of time now , and the prize well worth the waiting . By instinct , once more , [he]0-i turned to [the river]411-the river .

' And [she]146-maisie understood at once , '[0-i] [he]0-i said , looking at [the water]434-the water . ' [She]146-maisie found out [my]0-i pet besetting sin on the spot , and paid it off . [[My]0-i God]2254-my god , how [she]146-maisie understood ! And [she]146-maisie said [I]0-i was better than [she]146-maisie was ! Better than [she]146-maisie was ! '[0-i] [He]0-i laughed at the absurdity of the notion . ' [I]0-i wonder if [girls]2685-girls guess at [one - half a man]2686-one - half a man 's life . [They]2685-girls ca n't , or - [they]2685-girls would n't marry [us]2687-us . '[0-i] [He]0-i took [her]1109-her gift out of [his]0-i pocket , and considered it in the light of a miracle and a pledge of the comprehension that , one day , would lead to perfect happiness . Meantime , [Maisie]146-maisie was alone in [London]33-london , with none to save [her]146-maisie from danger . And [the packed wilderness]1110-the packed wilderness was very full of danger .

[Dick]147-dick made [his]147-dick prayer to [Fate]199-fate disjointedly after the manner of [the heathen]1111-the heathen as [he]147-dick threw the piece of silver into [the river]411-the river . If any evil were to befall , let [him]0-i bear the burden and let [Maisie]146-maisie go unscathed , since the threepenny piece was dearest to [him]0-i of all [his]0-i possessions . It was a small coin in itself , but [Maisie]146-maisie had given it , and [the Thames]41-the thames held it , and surely [the Fates]201-the fates would be bribed for this once .

The drowning of the coin seemed to cut [him]0-i free from thought of [Maisie]146-maisie for the moment . [He]0-i took [himself]0-i off [the bridge]2617-the bridge and went whistling to [[his]0-i chambers]1114-his chambers with a strong yearning for [some man]1115-some man - talk and tobacco after [his]0-i first experience of an entire day spent in the society of [a woman]730-a woman . There was a stronger desire at [his]0-i heart when there rose before [him]0-i an unsolicited vision of the Barralong dipping deep and sailing free for the Southern Cross .

CHAPTER VIII

And these two , as [I]0-i have told [you]1117-you , Were [the friends of [Hiawatha]202-hiawatha]1118-the friends of hiawatha , [Chibiabos]203-chibiabos , [the musician]1119-the musician , And [the very strong man]1120-the very strong man , [Kwasind]204-kwasind .

- [Hiawatha]202-hiawatha . [TORPENHOW]156-torpenhow was paging the last sheets of some manuscript , while [the Nilghai , who had come for chess and remained to talk tactics]1121-the nilghai , who had come for chess and remained to talk tactics , was reading through the first part , commenting scornfully the while .

' It 's picturesque enough and it 's sketchy , '[1121-the nilghai , who had come for chess and remained to talk tactics] said [he]1121-the nilghai , who had come for chess and remained to talk tactics ; ' but as a serious consideration of affairs in [Eastern Europe]69-eastern europe , it 's not worth much . '[1121-the nilghai , who had come for chess and remained to talk tactics]

[Young lambs]1122-young lambs to sell , [young lambs]1122-young lambs to sell , If [I]0-i 'd as much money as [I]0-i could tell , [I]0-i never would cry , Young lambs to sell ! [Dick]147-dick entered , self - conscious and a little defiant , but in the best of tempers with all [the world]327-the world .

' Back at last ? '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow .

' More or less . What have [you]147-dick been doing ? '[177-the nilghai]

' The notions come and go , [[my]177-the nilghai children]2689-my children - [they]2689-my children come and go like [our]2690-our '[177-the nilghai] baccy , ' [he]177-the nilghai answered , filling [his]177-the nilghai pipe . '[177-the nilghai]

[Binkie]180-binkie had jumped down from the sofa and was fawning round [Dick]147-dick 's knee , and scratching at [his]147-dick boots .

[Dick]147-dick returned with the big clasped sketch - book that [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai knew well and did not love too much . In it [Dick]147-dick had drawn all manner of moving incidents , experienced by [himself]147-dick or related to [him]147-dick by the others , of [all the four corners of [the earth]2665-the earth]1139-all the four corners of the earth . But the wider range of [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai 's body and life attracted [him]147-dick most . When truth failed [he]147-dick fell back on fiction of the wildest , and represented incidents in [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai 's career that were unseemly , - [his]177-the nilghai marriages with [many African princesses]1141-many african princesses , [his]177-the nilghai shameless betrayal , for [Arab wives]1142-arab wives , of [an army corps]1143-an army corps to [the Mahdi]160-the mahdi , [his]177-the nilghai tattooment by [skilled operators]1144-skilled operators in [Burmah]71-burmah , [his]177-the nilghai interview and [his]177-the nilghai fears with [the yellow headsman]1145-the yellow headsman in [the blood - stained execution - ground of [Canton]72-canton]1146-the blood - stained execution - ground of canton , and finally , the passings of [his]177-the nilghai spirit into the bodies of whales , elephants , and [toucans]1147-toucans . [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow from time to time had added rhymed descriptions , and the whole was a curious piece of art , because [Dick]147-dick decided , having regard to the name of the book which being interpreted means ' naked , '[147-dick] that it would be wrong to draw [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai with any clothes on , under any circumstances . Consequently the last sketch , representing [that much - enduring man calling on [the War Office]1149-the war office to press [his]177-the nilghai claims to the Egyptian medal]1148-that much - enduring man calling on the war office to press his claims to the egyptian medal , was hardly delicate . [He]147-dick settled [himself]147-dick comfortably on [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow 's table and turned over the pages .

' What a fortune [you]156-torpenhow would have been to [Blake]209-blake , [Nilghai]177-the nilghai ! '[147-dick] [he]147-dick said . ' There 's a succulent pinkness about some of these sketches that 's more than life - like . " The Nilghai surrounded while bathing by [the Mahdieh "]2719-the mahdieh " - that was founded on fact , eh ? '[147-dick]

' It was very nearly [my]147-dick last bath , [[you]156-torpenhow irreverent dauber]2720-you irreverent dauber . Has [Binkie]180-binkie come into [the Saga]2721-the saga yet ? '[147-dick]

' No ; [the Binkie - boy]2694-the binkie - boy has n't done anything except eat and kill cats . Let 's see . Here [you]156-torpenhow are as [a stained - glass saint in [a church]2724-a church]2723-a stained - glass saint in a church . '[147-dick]

' Has n't got any . '[147-dick]

' The undomestic life of [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai , then . Of course . Mass - meeting of [[his]177-the nilghai wives]2725-his wives in [Trafalgar Square]73-trafalgar square . That 's it . [They]2725-his wives came from [the ends of [the earth]2665-the earth]2726-the ends of the earth to attend [Nilghai]177-the nilghai 's wedding to [an English bride]2728-an english bride . ' It 's a scandalous waste of time , '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow .

' Do n't worry ; it keeps [one]727-one 's hand in - specially when [you]156-torpenhow begin without the pencil . '[156-torpenhow] [He]156-torpenhow set to work rapidly . ' That 's [Nelson]210-nelson 's Column . Presently [the Nilghai]2383-the nilghai will appear shinning up it . '[156-torpenhow]

' Give [him]177-the nilghai some clothes this time . '[147-dick]

' Certainly - a veil and an orange - wreath , because [he]177-the nilghai 's been married . '[156-torpenhow]

' Gad , that 's clever enough ! '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow over [his]156-torpenhow shoulder , as [Dick]147-dick brought out of the paper with three twirls of the brush a very fat back and labouring shoulder pressed against stone .

' Just imagine , '[147-dick] [Dick]147-dick continued , ' if [we]2731-we could publish a few of these dear little things every time [the Nilghai]2383-the nilghai subsidises [a man who can write]2733-a man who can write , to give [the public]692-the public an honest opinion of [my]147-dick pictures . '[147-dick]

' Well , [you]156-torpenhow 'll admit [I]156-torpenhow always tell [you]156-torpenhow when [I]156-torpenhow have done anything of that kind . [I]156-torpenhow know [I]156-torpenhow ca n't hammer [you]156-torpenhow as [you]156-torpenhow ought to be hammered , so [I]156-torpenhow give the job to [another]2735-another . [Young Maclagan]211-maclagan , for instance - - '[156-torpenhow]

' No - o - one half - minute , [old man]2243-old man ; stick [your]156-torpenhow hand out against the dark of the wall - paper - [you]156-torpenhow only burble and call [me]147-dick names . That left shoulder 's out of drawing . [I]147-dick must literally throw a veil over that . Where 's [my]147-dick pen - knife ? Well , what about [Maclagan]211-maclagan ? '[147-dick]

' [I]156-torpenhow only gave [him]211-maclagan [his]211-maclagan riding - orders to - to lambast [you]156-torpenhow on general principles for not producing work that will last . '[156-torpenhow]

'[156-torpenhow] [She]1208-she says [she]1208-she wants to sympathise with [you]147-dick and help [you]147-dick in [your]147-dick work , and everything else that clearly [a man]308-a man must do for [himself]308-a man . Then [she]1208-she sends round five notes a day to ask why the dickens [you]147-dick have n't been wasting [your]147-dick time with [her]1208-she . '[1208-she]

' Do n't generalise , '[177-the nilghai] said [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai . ' By the time [you]147-dick arrive at five notes a day [you]147-dick must have gone through a good deal and behaved accordingly .[177-the nilghai]

Should n't begin these things , [[my]0-i son]1210-my son . '[1208-she]

' [I]147-dick should n't have gone down to [the sea]2168-the sea , '[147-dick] said [Dick]147-dick , just a little anxious to change the conversation . ' And [you]147-dick should n't have sung . '[147-dick]

' [The sea]2168-the sea is n't sending [you]147-dick five notes a day , '[177-the nilghai] said [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai .

' No , but [I]1208-she 'm[1208-she] fatally compromised . [She]1208-she 's [an enduring old hag]1211-an enduring old hag , and [I]0-i 'm sorry [I]177-the nilghai ever met [her]1208-she . Why was n't [I]177-the nilghai born and bred and dead in a three - pair back ? '[177-the nilghai]

' Hear [him]147-dick blaspheming [his]147-dick first love ! Why in [the world]327-the world should n't [you]147-dick listen to [her]1208-she ? '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow .

Before [Dick]147-dick could reply [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai lifted up [his]177-the nilghai voice with a shout that shook the windows , in ' [The Men of [the Sea]60-the sea]2834-the men of the sea , '[177-the nilghai] that begins , as [all]535-all know , ' [The sea]2168-the sea is [a wicked old woman]2836-a wicked old woman , '[177-the nilghai] and after reading through eight lines whose imagery is truthful , ends in a refrain , slow as the clacking of a capstan when [the boat]407-the boat comes unwillingly up to the bars where [the men]528-the men sweat and tramp in the shingle .

' " [Ye]2834-the men of the sea that bore [us]2834-the men of the sea , O restore [us]2834-the men of the sea ! [She]2168-the sea is kinder than [ye]2834-the men of the sea ; For the call is on [our]2834-the men of the sea heart - strings ! " Said [The Men of [the Sea]60-the sea]2834-the men of the sea . '[177-the nilghai] [The Nilghai]177-the nilghai sang that verse twice , with simple cunning , intending that [Dick]147-dick should hear . But [Dick]147-dick was waiting for the farewell of [the men]528-the men to [[their]528-the men wives]1216-their wives .

' " [Ye]2834-the men of the sea that love [us]2834-the men of the sea , can [ye]2834-the men of the sea move [us]2834-the men of the sea ? [She]2838-she is dearer than [ye]2834-the men of the sea ; And [your]2834-the men of the sea sleep will be the sweeter , " Said [The Men of [the Sea]60-the sea]2834-the men of the sea . '[147-dick] The rough words beat like the blows of the waves on the bows of [the rickety boat]1217-the rickety boat from [Lima]74-lima in the days when [Dick]147-dick was mixing paints , making love , drawing [devils and angels in the half dark]1218-devils and angels in the half dark , and wondering whether the next minute would put [the Italian captain]1219-the italian captain 's knife between [his]147-dick shoulder - blades . And the go - fever which is more real than [many doctors]1220-many doctors ' diseases , waked and raged , urging [him]147-dick who loved [Maisie]146-maisie beyond anything in [the world]327-the world , to go away and taste the old hot , unregenerate life again , - to scuffle , swear , gamble , and love light loves with [[his]147-dick fellows]2841-his fellows ; to take [ship]2842-ship and know [the sea]2168-the sea once more , and by [her]146-maisie beget pictures ; to talk to [Binat]162-madame among [the sands of [Port]36-port said]2844-the sands of port Said while [Yellow]230-yellow '[231-tina] [Tina]231-tina mixed the drinks ; to hear the crackle of musketry , and see the smoke roll outward , thin and thicken again till the shining black faces came through , and in that hell [every man]1221-every man was strictly responsible for [his]1221-every man own head , and [his]1221-every man own alone , and struck with an unfettered arm . It was impossible , utterly impossible , but -

' " Oh , [[our]2845-our fathers]2846-our fathers in [the churchyard]2847-the churchyard , [She]146-maisie is older than [ye]156-torpenhow , And [[our]2845-our graves]2848-our graves will be the greener , " Said [The Men of [the Sea]60-the sea]2834-the men of the sea . '[177-the nilghai] ' What is there to hinder ? '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow , in the long hush that followed the song .

' [You]156-torpenhow said a little time since that [you]156-torpenhow would n't come for a walk round [the world]327-the world , [Torp]167-torp . '[156-torpenhow]

' That was months ago , and [I]177-the nilghai only objected to [your]156-torpenhow making money for travelling expenses . [You]156-torpenhow 've shot [your]156-torpenhow bolt here and it has gone [home]2172-home . Go away and do some work , and see some things . '[177-the nilghai]

' Get some of the fat off [you]177-the nilghai ; [you]177-the nilghai 're[156-torpenhow] disgracefully out of condition , ' said [the Nilghai]177-the nilghai , making a plunge from the chair and grasping a handful of Dick generally over the right ribs . '[156-torpenhow] Soft as putty - pure tallow born of over - feeding . Train it off , [Dickie]175-dickie . '[175-dickie]

' [We]2852-we 're[177-the nilghai] all equally gross , [Nilghai]177-the nilghai . Next time [you]177-the nilghai have to take [the field]2328-the field [you]177-the nilghai 'll sit down , wink [your]177-the nilghai eyes , gasp , and die in a fit . '[177-the nilghai]

' Never mind . [You]177-the nilghai go away on [a ship]2853-a ship . Go to [Lima]74-lima again , or to [Brazil]87-brazil .[175-dickie]

There 's always trouble in [South America]88-south america . '[177-the nilghai]

' Do [you]177-the nilghai suppose [I]177-the nilghai want to be told where to go ? Great Heavens , the only difficulty is to know where [I]177-the nilghai 'm[177-the nilghai] to stop . But [I]0-i shall stay here , as [I]0-i told [you]1223-you before . '[0-i]

' Then [you]177-the nilghai 'll be buried in [Kensal Green]80-kensal green and turn into adipocere with the others , '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow . ' Are [you]177-the nilghai thinking of commissions in hand ? Pay forfeit and go . [You]177-the nilghai 've money enough to travel as [a king]2854-a king if [you]177-the nilghai please . '[156-torpenhow]

' [You]177-the nilghai 've the grisliest notions of amusement , [Torp]167-torp . [I]156-torpenhow think [I]156-torpenhow see [myself]156-torpenhow shipping first class on [a six - thousand - ton hotel]2855-a six - thousand - ton hotel , and asking [the third engineer]2856-the third engineer what makes the engines go round , and whether it is n't very warm in [the stokehold]2857-the stokehold . Ho ! ho ! [I]156-torpenhow should ship as [a loafer]2858-a loafer if ever [I]156-torpenhow shipped at all , which [I]156-torpenhow 'm[156-torpenhow] not going to do . [I]0-i shall compromise , and go for a small trip to begin with . '[0-i]

' That 's something at any rate . Where will [you]177-the nilghai go ? '[156-torpenhow] said [Torpenhow]156-torpenhow . ' It would do [you]177-the nilghai all the good in [the world]327-the world , [old man]2243-old man . '[156-torpenhow]

[The Nilghai]177-the nilghai saw the twinkle in [Dick]147-dick 's eye , and refrained from speech .

' [I]177-the nilghai shall go in the first place to [[Rathray]232-rathray 's stable]2861-rathray 's stable , where [I]177-the nilghai shall hire one horse , and take [him]147-dick very carefully as far as [Richmond Hill]90-richmond hill .
